Text

[Piccadilly]7-piccadilly , 2d February 1865 In a window , a few doors from [Cambridge House]2-cambridge house , the following placard some time since invited , apparently without much effect , the notice of [the passers - by,—"To]1849-the passers - by,—"to let , [this desirable family mansion]1850-this desirable family mansion , "[1851-the " desirable family] After a considerable period [the " desirable family]1851-the " desirable family "[1851-the " desirable family] seem to have been given up in despair , and the words vanished from the scene ; but the board in the window , beginning " to let "[1851-the " desirable family] remained , while [the " mansion]1852-the " mansion "[1851-the " desirable family] itself was converted upon [it]261-it into " [unfurnished chambers]1853-unfurnished chambers . "[1851-the " desirable family] As , in the words of [that " humble companion , "[262-that " humble companion , " whose life was rendered a burden to her by my poor dear mother] whose life was rendered a burden to [her]262-that " humble companion , " whose life was rendered a burden to her by my poor dear mother by [[my]0-i poor dear mother]263-my poor dear mother]262-that " humble companion , " whose life was rendered a burden to her by my poor dear mother , " Money was not so much an object as [a comfortable home]1854-a comfortable home , "[262-that " humble companion , " whose life was rendered a burden to her by my poor dear mother] [I]0-i did not hesitate to instal [myself]0-i in the first floor , which possessed the advantage of a bay - window , with a double sash to keep out the noise , together with an extensive view of [Green Park]3-green park , and [a sailor without legs perpetually drawing ships]264-a sailor without legs perpetually drawing ships upon the opposite pavement , as a foreground . [[My]0-i friend]265-my friend [Lord Grandon]110-grandon , who is [an Irish peer with a limited income]266-an irish peer with a limited income , took the floor above , as [I]0-i was desirous of securing [myself]0-i against thumping overhead ; moreover , [I]0-i am extremely fond of [him]265-my friend . When [I]0-i say that the position which [I]0-i enjoy socially , is as well adapted for seeing life as the locality [I]0-i selected for [[my]0-i residence]267-my residence , [most of [[my]0-i more fashionable readers]269-my more fashionable readers]268-most of my more fashionable readers will intuitively discover who [I]0-i am ; fortunately , [I]0-i have no cause to desire to maintain an incognito which would be impossible , though , perhaps , [I]0-i ought to explain the motives which induce [me]0-i now to bring [myself]0-i even more prominently before the public than [I]0-i have been in the habit of doing . Sitting in [my]0-i bay - window the other evening , and reading the ' History of Civilisation , ' by [[my]0-i late lamented friend]270-my late lamented friend [Mr Buckle]111-mr buckle , it occurred to [me]0-i that [I]0-i also would write a history of civilisation — after having seen [the world]271-the world , instead of before doing so , as was the case with [that gifted philosopher]272-that gifted philosopher . Having for many years past devoted [myself]0-i to the study of [[my]0-i fellow - men]273-my fellow - men in [all countries]274-all countries , [I]0-i thought the time had come when [I]0-i could , with profit to [myself]0-i and [the world]271-the world , give it the benefit of [my]0-i extended experience and [my]0-i quick observation . No sooner had [I]0-i arrived at this determination , than with characteristic promptitude [I]0-i proceeded to put it into execution ; and singular though it may appear , it was not until then that [I]0-i found [myself]0-i quite incompetent to carry out the vast project [I]0-i had undertaken . The reason was at once apparent — [I]0-i had seen and thought too much ; and was in the position which [[my]0-i predecessor]276-my predecessor had failed to reach , of experimentally discovering that the task was beyond the human power of accomplishment . Not easily vanquished , [I]0-i then thought of subdividing it , and dealing exclusively with [a single branch of civilisation]277-a single branch of civilisation . [Mr Thomas Taylor Meadows]112-mr thomas taylor meadows , thought [I]0-i , has written a very elaborate chapter upon the progress of civilisation as regarded from a [Chinese]4-chinese point of view , why should not [I]0-i look upon it from a purely Piccadillean?—so [I]0-i immediately looked at it . The hour 11 P.M. ; a long string of carriages advancing under [my]0-i windows to [Lady Palmerston]113-lady palmerston 's ; rain pelting ; [horses with ears pressed back , wincing under the storm]278-horses with ears pressed back , wincing under the storm ; [coachmen]279-coachmen and [footmen]280-footmen presenting the crowns of [their]280-footmen hats to it ; streams running down [their]280-footmen waterproofs , and causing them to glitter in the gaslight ; now and then the flash of a jewel inside [the carriages]281-the carriages ; nothing visible of [the occupants]282-the occupants but flounces surging up at the windows , as if [they]281-the carriages were made of some delicious creamy substance , and were going to overflow into [the street]283-the street ; [policemen]284-policemen in large capes , and if [I]0-i may be allowed the expression , " helmetically "[284-policemen] sealed from the wet , keeping order ; [draggled women on foot]285-draggled women on foot " moving "[284-policemen] rapidly on . [The fine ladies in [[their]286-the fine ladies in their carriages carriages]287-their carriages]286-the fine ladies in their carriages moving on too — but not quite so fast . This Piccadillean view of the progress of civilisation suggested to [me]0-i many serious reflections ; among others , that if [I]0-i intended to go to [Cambridge House]288-cambridge house [myself]0-i , the sooner [I]0-i went to dress the better . Which way are [we]289-we moving ? [I]0-i mused , as [I]0-i made the smallest of white bows immediately over a pearl stud in [my]0-i neck . [I]0-i gave up the " history "[0-i] of civilisation . [I]0-i certainly ca n't call it " the progress "[0-i] of civilisation ; that does all very well for [Pekin]114-pekin , not for [London]5-london . Shall [I]0-i do the Gibbon business , and call it " the decline and fall "[0-i] of civilisation?—and [I]0-i absently thrust two right - hand gloves into [my]0-i pocket by mistake , and scrambling across the wet pavement into [my]0-i brougham , drove in it the length of the file and arrived before [I]0-i had settled this important question . While [Lady Veriphast]115-lady veriphast , having planted [me]0-i en tête - à - tête in a remote corner , was entertaining [me]0-i with [her]115-lady veriphast accustomed vivacity , [I]0-i am conscious of having gazed into those large swimming eyes with a vacant stare so utterly at variance with [my]0-i usual animated expression , that [she]115-lady veriphast said at last , rather pettishly , " What are [you]0-i thinking about ? "[115-lady veriphast] " Civilisation , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , abruptly . " [You]0-i mean Conventionalism , "[115-lady veriphast] [she]115-lady veriphast replied ; " have [you]0-i come to the conclusion , as [I]115-lady veriphast have , that all conventionalism is vanity ? "[115-lady veriphast] " No ; only that it is ' vexation of spirit ; ' that is the part that belongs to [us]1855-us — [we]1855-us leave the ' vanity ' to [the women]1856-the women . "[115-lady veriphast] " Dear [me]115-lady veriphast , [I]115-lady veriphast never heard [you]0-i so solemn and profound before . Are [you]0-i in love ? "[115-lady veriphast] " No , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " [I]0-i am thinking of writing a book , but [I]0-i do n't see [my]0-i way to it . "[0-i] " And the subject is the Conventionalism which [you]0-i call civilisation . Well , [I]115-lady veriphast do n't wonder at [your]0-i looking vacant . [You]0-i are not quite up to it , [Lord Frank]116-lord frank . Why do n't [you]0-i write a novel ? "[115-lady veriphast] " [My]115-lady veriphast imagination is too vivid , and would run away with [me]115-lady veriphast . "[115-lady veriphast] " Nothing else would , "[290-she] [she]290-she said , laughing ; " but if [you]0-i do n't like fiction , [you]0-i can always fall back upon fact ; be [the hero of [your]0-i own romance]1857-the hero of your own romance , publish [your]0-i diary , and call it ' The Experiences of [a Product of the Highest State of Civilisation]1858-a product of the highest state of civilisation . ' Thus [you]0-i will be able to write about civilisation and [yourself]0-i at the same time , which [I]290-she am sure [you]0-i will like . [I]290-she want some tea , please ; do [you]0-i know [you]0-i are rather dull to - night ? "[290-she] And [Lady Veriphast]115-lady veriphast walked [me]0-i into the middle of [the crowd]291-the crowd , and abandoned [me]0-i abruptly for [somebody else]292-somebody else , with whom [she]290-she returned to [her]290-she corner , and [I]0-i went and had tea by [myself]0-i . But [Lady Veriphast]115-lady veriphast had put [me]0-i on the right track : why , [I]0-i thought as [I]0-i scrambled back again from [my]0-i brougham across the wet pavement to [my]0-i bay - window , should [I]0-i not begin at once to write about the civilisation of the day ? ' The Civilisation of [the British Isles]6-the british isles , as exhibited in [Piccadilly]7-piccadilly , a Fragment of Contemporaneous Biography , ' that would not be a bad title ; [people]293-people would think , if [I]0-i called it a biography , it must be true ; here [I]0-i squared [my]0-i elbows before a quantity of foolscap , dipped [my]0-i pen in the ink , and dashed off the introduction as above . Next morning [I]0-i got up and began again as follows : Why should [I]0-i commit the ridiculous error of supposing that the incidents of [my]0-i daily life are not likely to interest [the world]271-the world at large ? Whether [I]0-i read the diary of [Mr Pepys]117-mr pepys , or of [Lady Morgan]118-lady morgan — whether [I]0-i wade through the Journal of [Mr Evelyn]119-mr evelyn , or pleasantly while away an hour with the memoirs of " [a Lady of Quality]1859-a lady of quality , "[0-i] [I]0-i am equally struck with this traditional practice of [the bores]295-the bores and [the wits of [society]297-society]296-the wits of society , to write at length the records of [their]298-their daily life , bottle [them]298-their carefully up in a series of MS . volumes , and leave [them]298-their to [[their]298-their grandchildren]299-their grandchildren to publish , and to posterity to criticise . Now it has always appeared to [me]0-i that the whole fun of writing was to watch the immediate effect produced by one 's own literary genius . If , in addition to this , it is possible to interest [the public]300-the public in the current events of [one]301-one 's life , what nobler object of ambition could [a man]302-a man propose to [himself]302-a man ? Thus , though the circle of [[my]0-i personal acquaintances]303-my personal acquaintances may not be increased , [I]0-i shall feel [my]0-i sympathies are becoming enlarged with each succeeding mark of confidence [I]0-i bestow upon [the numerous readers to whom [I]0-i will recount the most intimate relations of [my]0-i life]304-the numerous readers to whom i will recount the most intimate relations of my life . [I]0-i will tell [them]304-the numerous readers to whom i will recount the most intimate relations of my life of [my]0-i aspirations and [my]0-i failures — of [my]0-i hopes and fears , of [[my]0-i friends]305-my friends and [[my]0-i enemies]306-my enemies . [I]0-i shall not shrink from alluding to the state of [my]0-i affections ; and if the still unfulfilled story of [my]0-i life becomes involved with the destiny of [others]307-others , and entangles itself in an inextricable manner , that is no concern of [mine]0-i . [I]0-i shall do nothing to be ashamed of , or that [I]0-i ca n't tell ; and if truth turn out stranger than fiction , so much the better for [[my]0-i readers]308-my readers . It may be that [I]0-i shall become [the hero of a sensation episode in real life]309-the hero of a sensation episode in real life , for the future looks vague and complicated enough ; but it is much better to make [the world]271-the world [[my]0-i friend]265-my friend before anything serious occurs , than allow posterity to misjudge [my]0-i conduct when [I]0-i am no longer alive to explain it . Now , at least , [I]0-i have the satisfaction of knowing that whatever happens [I]0-i shall give [my]0-i version of the story first . Should the daily tenor of [my]0-i life be undisturbed , [I]0-i can always fall back upon the exciting character of [my]0-i opinions . As [I]0-i write , the magnitude of the task [I]0-i propose to [myself]0-i assumes still larger proportions . [I]0-i yearn to develop in [the world]271-the world at large those organs of conscientiousness and benevolence which [we]313-we all possess but so few exercise . [I]0-i invoke the cooperation of [[my]0-i readers]308-my readers in this great work : [I]0-i implore [them]308-my readers to accompany [me]0-i step by step in the crusade which [I]0-i am about to preach in favour of the sacrifice of self for the public good . [I]0-i demand [their]308-my readers sympathy in this monthly record of [my]0-i trials as an uncompromising exponent of the motives of the day , and [I]0-i claim [their]308-my readers tender solicitude should [I]0-i writhe , crushed and mangled by the iron hand of a social tyranny dexterously concealed in its velvet glove . [I]0-i will begin [my]0-i efforts at reform with [the Church]8-the church ; [I]0-i may then possibly diverge to [the Legislature]315-the legislature , and [I]0-i will mix in [the highest circles of society]316-the highest circles of society in the spirit of [a missionary]317-a missionary . [I]0-i will endeavour to show [everybody]318-everybody up to [everybody else]319-everybody else in the spirit of love ; and if [they]308-my readers end by quarrelling with [each other]320-each other and with [me]0-i , [I]0-i shall at least have the satisfaction of feeling [myself]0-i divested of all further responsibility in the matter . In [my]0-i present frame of mind apathy would be culpable and weakness a crime .... Candour compels [me]0-i to state that when , as [I]0-i told [Lady Veriphast]115-lady veriphast , [my]0-i imagination becomes heated , [my]0-i pen travels with a velocity which fails to convey any adequate impression of the seething thoughts which course through [my]0-i brain . [I]0-i lose [myself]0-i in [my]0-i subject , and become almost insensible to external sensations ; thus it happened that [I]0-i did not hear the door open as [I]0-i was writing the above , and [I]0-i was totally unconscious as [I]0-i was reading fervently aloud the last paragraph , containing those aspirations which [I]0-i promised to confide to [the public]300-the public , that [I]0-i had already [a listener]322-a listener . Judge of [my]0-i surprise — [I]0-i may say dismay — when , just as [I]0-i had finished , and was biting the end of [my]0-i pen for a new inspiration , [I]0-i heard the voice of [Grandon]110-grandon close behind [my]0-i chair . " Well done , [[my]110-grandon dear]1860-my dear [Frank]116-lord frank , "[110-grandon] [he]110-grandon said — and as [he]110-grandon has known [me]0-i from [my]0-i boyhood , [he]110-grandon can make allowances for [my]0-i fervent nature . " [Your]116-lord frank programme is very complete , but [I]110-grandon doubt [your]116-lord frank being able to carry it out . How , for instance , do [you]116-lord frank propose to open the campaign against [the Church]1861-the church ? "[110-grandon] If there is one quality upon which [I]0-i pride [myself]0-i more than another it is readiness . [I]0-i certainly had not formed the slightest conception of how these burning thoughts of [mine]0-i should be put into execution ; but [I]0-i did not hesitate a second in [my]0-i answer . " [I]0-i shall go down to [a bishop]1862-a bishop and stay with [him]1862-a bishop in [[his]1862-a bishop palace]1863-his palace , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , promptly . " Which one ? "[110-grandon] said [Grandon]110-grandon . [I]0-i was going to say " [Oxbridge]9-oxbridge , "[0-i] as [he]110-grandon is [the only one [I]0-i happen to know]323-the only one i happen to know ; but , in the first place , [I]0-i am a little afraid of [him]110-grandon ; and , in the second , [I]0-i am hardly on sufficiently intimate terms with [him]110-grandon to venture to propose [myself]0-i — so [I]0-i said , with some effrontery , " Oh , to [a colonial bishop , whom [you]110-grandon do n't know]1864-a colonial bishop , whom you do n't know . "[0-i] " Nor [you]0-i either , [I]110-grandon suspect , "[110-grandon] laughed [Grandon]110-grandon . " Just at present [colonial bishops]1865-colonial bishops are rather scarce articles , and [I]0-i have never heard of one in [England]10-england with [a palace]1866-a palace , though there are a good many of [them]1865-colonial bishops dotted about in snug livings , retaining only [their]1865-colonial bishops lawn sleeves , either to laugh in or remind [them]1865-colonial bishops of the dignity and the hardships of which [they]1865-colonial bishops did not die abroad . [Their]1865-colonial bishops temptations are of a totally different nature from [theirs]1865-colonial bishops who are [members of the House of Peers]1867-members of the house of peers , and [they]1865-colonial bishops must be treated apart ; in fact , [you]1868-you will have to take [them]1865-colonial bishops with [the missionaries]1869-the missionaries and [colonial clergy]1870-colonial clergy . [I]0-i quite agree with [you]1868-you that if there is one thing that is more urgently needed than [a missionary to [the ball - room]1872-the ball - room]1871-a missionary to the ball - room , it is [a missionary to [the missionaries]1869-the missionaries]1873-a missionary to the missionaries ; and as [you]1868-you have had so much experience of [their]1869-the missionaries operations abroad , [you]1868-you might become [a very useful labourer in the ecclesiastical vineyard]1875-a very useful labourer in the ecclesiastical vineyard . "[0-i] [I]0-i need scarcely say that [my]0-i heart leaped at the thought ; it was a work for which [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i specially qualified . " Why , "[0-i] [I]0-i have thought , " should there be [a set of men who preach to [others]307-others , and are never preached at [themselves]1876-a set of men who preach to others , and are never preached at themselves]1876-a set of men who preach to others , and are never preached at themselves ? Every class and condition of life has its peculiar snares and temptations , and [one class]1878-one class is set apart to point [them]1876-a set of men who preach to others , and are never preached at themselves out — surely there should be [somebody]1879-somebody to perform that kind office for [them]1876-a set of men who preach to others , and are never preached at themselves which [they]1876-a set of men who preach to others , and are never preached at themselves do for [others]307-others . [He]1881-his who is paid to find out the mote that is in [[his]1881-his brother]1882-his brother 's eye , and devotes [his]1881-his energies to its discovery , is of [all men the one who requires [the most kind and faithful friend]1884-the most kind and faithful friend to show [him]1881-his the beam which is in [his]1881-his own]1883-all men the one who requires the most kind and faithful friend to show him the beam which is in his own . [I]0-i will be [that friend]1885-that friend , and charge nothing for it , "[0-i] thought I. [Grandon]110-grandon saw the flush of enthusiasm which mounted to [my]0-i brow , and looked grave . " [[My]110-grandon impulsive friend]1886-my impulsive friend , "[110-grandon] [he]110-grandon said , " this is a very serious subject ; [we]1887-we must beware lest [we]1887-we fall into the error which [we]1887-we blame in [others]307-others . It is one thing to see the need of [the missionary]1889-the missionary , it is another to rush headlong upon the work . Second , " The still deep fast . "[369-the wholly worldly first] This may seem to be a contradiction in terms ; but the fact is , while the upper surface seems tranquil enough , there is a strong rapid undercurrent . The danger is , in this case , that [you]370-you are very apt to go in what is called a " header . "[370-you] The moment [you]370-you dive [you]370-you get caught by the undercurrent , and the chances are [you]370-you never rise to the surface again . Third , " The rippling glancing fast . "[370-you] This is less fatal , but to [my]0-i mind not so attractive as the other . The ripples are produced by quantities of pebbles , which are sure to give one what is called in [America]17-america " a rough time . "[370-you] The glancing is only dangerous to [youths]371-youths in the first stage , and is perfectly innocuous after one season . Fourth , " The rushing gushing fast . "[370-you] This speaks for itself , and may be considered perfectly harmless . There are only two slows — the " strong - minded blue slow , "[370-you] and the " heavy slow . "[370-you] The " strong - minded blue slow "[370-you] includes every branch of learning . It is extremely rare , and alarming to [the youth of the day]372-the youth of the day . [Boys]1964-boys go to [school]1965-school with strict injunctions if possible to put [self]1966-self at the top of it . [They]1964-boys take the highest honours at [the university]1967-the university purely for the sake of self . [I]0-i confess [I]0-i have rather a weakness for [Joseph]136-joseph . [He]136-joseph has a blunt off - hand way of treating the most sacred topics , that [you]393-you only find among [those who are professionally familiar with the subject]394-those who are professionally familiar with the subject . There is a force and an ease in [his]136-joseph mode of dealing with inspiration at such a moment which [you]393-you feel must give [him]136-joseph an immense ascendancy over [the native mind]396-the native mind . [He]136-joseph possesses what may be termed a dry ecclesiastical humour , differing entirely from [Chundango]126-chundango 's , whose theological fun takes rather the form of Scriptural riddles , picked up while [he]136-joseph was [a catechist]1912-a catechist . ' As [I]0-i think some of the late doctrinal decisions of [the judicial committee]2054-the judicial committee are questionable , [I]0-i am drawing up a bill for the reform of the Protestant religion , and for the addition of a fortieth article to the existing thirty - nine . [I]0-i shall feel bound to trouble [the Bishop]336-the bishop again with a few practical remarks . There is no knowing whether even [he]336-the bishop may not be brought to perceive that [you]2084-you might as well try to extract warmth from an iceberg as divine inspiration from [the State]28-the state , and that a Church without inspiration is simply a grate without fire . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll put [myself]0-i out of suspense to - morrow , and keep [the public]300-the public in it for a month , " thought [I]0-i , as [I]0-i penned the above for [their]300-the public benefit , after which [I]0-i indulged in two hours of troubled sleep . [Flityville]29-flityville , March 20 . As the event which [I]0-i am about to recount forms the turning - point of [my]0-i life — unless , indeed , something still more remarkable happens , which [I]0-i do not at present foresee , to turn [me]0-i back again — [I]0-i do not feel that it would be either becoming , or indeed possible , for [me]0-i to maintain that vein of easy cheerfulness which has characterised [my]0-i composition hitherto . What is fun to [you]0-i , O [[my]0-i reader]2099-my reader ! may be death to [me]0-i ; and nothing can be further from [my]0-i intention than to excite the smallest tendency to risibility on [your]0-i part at [my]0-i misfortunes or trials . [You]0-i will already have guessed what these are ; but how to recur to those agonising details , how to present to [you]0-i the picture of [my]0-i misery in its true colours,—nothing but the stern determination to carry out [my]0-i original design , and the conscientious conviction that "[0-i] the story of [my]0-i life from month to month " may be made a profitable study to [[my]0-i fellow - men]273-my fellow - men , could induce [me]0-i in this cold - blooded way to tear open the still unhealed wound . [I]0-i came down to breakfast rather late on the morning following the events narrated in the last chapter . [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem and [Grandon]110-grandon had already vanished from the scene ; so had [Mr Wog]131-mr wog , who went up to [town]2093-town to see what [he]131-mr wog called "[0-i] the elephant,"—an American expression , signifying "[0-i] to gain experience of [the world]271-the world . " The phrase originated in an occurrence at [a menagerie]2102-a menagerie , and as upon this occasion [Mr Wog]131-mr wog applied it to the opening of [Parliament]15-parliament , it was not altogether inappropriate . [I]0-i found still lingering over the debris of breakfast [[my]0-i host]2103-my host and hostess , [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem and [[her]166-lady broadhem daughters]2104-her daughters , [the Bishop]336-the bishop and [Chundango]126-chundango . [The latter]2106-the latter appeared to be having all the talk to [himself]2106-the latter , and , to give [him]2106-the latter [his]2106-the latter due , [his]2106-the latter conversation was generally entertaining . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear mother]415-my dear mother , " [he]2106-the latter was saying , "[0-i] still unconverted , has buried all [my]0-i jewellery in [the back verandah]416-the back verandah . After [I]0-i had cleared a million sterling , [I]0-i divided it into two parts ; with one part [I]0-i bought jewels , of which [[my]0-i mother]417-my mother is [an excellent judge]418-an excellent judge , and the other [I]0-i put out at interest . " "[0-i] Then , did [you]0-i give all [your]0-i jewels to [[your]0-i mother]419-your mother ? " asked [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem . "[0-i] Oh no ; [she]419-your mother is only keeping them till [I]0-i can bestow them upon [the woman [I]0-i choose for [[her]419-your mother daughter - in - law]421-her daughter - in - law]420-the woman i choose for her daughter - in - law . " "[419-your mother] Are [you]0-i looking out for [her]419-your mother now ? " [I]0-i asked , somewhat abruptly . "[0-i] Yes , [[my]0-i dear friend]422-my dear friend , " said [John]126-chundango ; "[0-i] [I]0-i hope to find in [England]10-england [some Christian young person as a yoke - mate]423-some christian young person as a yoke - mate . "[0-i] It is not [the Premier]442-the premier 's fault at all , " said [I]437-the prime minister of this country ; "[437-the prime minister of this country] [he]437-the prime minister of this country may be [the most liberal theologian possible]443-the most liberal theologian possible , but [he]437-the prime minister of this country has nothing to do with doctrine ; that lies in [[the Chancellor]444-the chancellor 's department]445-the chancellor 's department . As [the supreme arbiter in points of religious belief]446-the supreme arbiter in points of religious belief , and as [the largest dispenser of spiritual patronage in [the kingdom]448-the kingdom]447-the largest dispenser of spiritual patronage in the kingdom , it is evident that the qualifications for [a Lord Chancellor]449-a lord chancellor should be not so much [his]449-a lord chancellor knowledge of law , as [his]449-a lord chancellor unblemished moral character and incapacity for perpetrating jobs . " "[166-lady broadhem] [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , " said [I]166-lady broadhem , sternly , "[166-lady broadhem] when [the money - changers]481-the money - changers were scourged out of [the Temple]482-the temple there was no want of reverence displayed towards the service to which [it]482-the temple was dedicated ; and it seems to [me]0-i , that to sell ' [the Temple]482-the temple ' itself , whether under the name of an ' advowson , ' a ' living , ' or a ' cure of souls , ' is the very climax of irreverence , not to use a stronger term ; and when [the Lord Chancellor]473-the lord chancellor brings in an Act for the purpose of facilitating this traffic in ' souls , ' and ' augmenting the benefices ' derived from curing them , [I]0-i think it is high time , at the risk of giving offence to [[my]0-i friend]265-my friend [the Bishop]336-the bishop , and to [the ecclesiastical establishment]487-the ecclesiastical establishment generally , to speak out . What times have [we]488-we fallen upon that the priesthood itself , once an inspiration , has become a trade?"[1 ] [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem seemed a little cowed by [my]491-literates vehemence , which some might have thought amounted to rudeness , but would not abandon the field . "[491-literates] The result , " [she]166-lady broadhem said , "[491-literates] of impoverishing [the Church]1861-the church will be , that [you]490-you will only get [literates]491-literates to go into it ; as it is , compared with other professions , it holds out no inducement for [young men of family]492-young men of family . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't think [you]490-you would , any more than [the Pharisees]501-the pharisees would have gained by being reduced to the level of [the Sadducees]145-the sadducees ; not that [I]0-i would wish to use either term offensively towards [the conscientious individuals who were , doubtless , comprised in the above sects in old time]502-the conscientious individuals who were , doubtless , comprised in the above sects in old time , still less as a reproach to [the excellent men who fill [the churches and chapels of [this country]1901-this country]504-the churches and chapels of this country now]503-the excellent men who fill the churches and chapels of this country now ; but it has possibly not occurred to [them]502-the conscientious individuals who were , doubtless , comprised in the above sects in old time that the Churchianity of the present day bears as little resemblance to the Christianity of eighteen hundred years ago , as [the latter]2106-the latter did to the worship it came to supersede ; " and [I]507-good fellow felt [I]507-good fellow had sown seed in [the ecclesiastical vineyard]2118-the ecclesiastical vineyard , and would leave it to fructify . "[507-good fellow] [Good fellow]507-good fellow , [Frank]116-lord frank ! " [I]116-lord frank overheard [Dickiefield]120-dickiefield say , as [I]116-lord frank left [the room]2119-the room ; "[116-lord frank] it is a pity [his]116-lord frank head is a little turned ! " "[116-lord frank] Ah , " [I]116-lord frank thought , "[116-lord frank] something is upside down ; perhaps it is [my]0-i head , but [I]0-i rather think it is [the world]271-the world generally , including always [the religious world]509-the religious world . It seemed to have taken a start in the right direction nearly two thousand years ago , and now it has all slipped back again worse than ever , and is whirling the wrong way with a rapidity that makes [one]301-one giddy . [I]0-i feel more giddy than usual to - day , somehow , " [I]0-i soliloquised ; "[0-i] and every time [I]0-i look at [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula , [I]0-i feel exactly as if [I]0-i had smoked too much . It ca n't be really that , so [I]0-i 'll light a cigar and steady [my]0-i nerves before [I]0-i come to the tremendous issue . [She]124-lady ursula is too sensible to mind [my]0-i smelling of tobacco . " These were the thoughts that passed through [my]124-lady ursula somewhat bewildered brain , as [I]124-lady ursula stepped out upon [the terrace]2120-the terrace and lit [my]124-lady ursula cigar . So far from [my]124-lady ursula nerves becoming steadier , however , under the usually soothing influence , [I]124-lady ursula felt [my]124-lady ursula heart beating more rapidly each time [I]124-lady ursula endeavoured to frame the sentence upon which was to depend the happiness of [my]124-lady ursula life , until at last [my]124-lady ursula resolution gave way altogether , and [I]124-lady ursula determined to put upon paper , in the form of an interrogatory , the momentous question . ' "[0-i] " Spare [me]124-lady ursula , [I]124-lady ursula implore [you]140-chundango , "[124-lady ursula] said [Ursula]124-lady ursula , in a voice betraying great agitation . " [You]140-chundango do n't know the pain [you]140-chundango are giving [me]124-lady ursula . "[124-lady ursula] Whether [Chundango]140-chundango at this moment fell on [his]140-chundango knees , which [I]0-i do n't think likely , as [natives]527-natives never thus far humble [themselves]527-natives before the sex , or whether [he]140-chundango stumbled over a footstool in trying to prevent [her]124-lady ursula leaving [the room]2119-the room — which is more probable — [I]0-i could not discover . "[166-lady broadhem] Although [I]0-i am able to record this speech word for word , [I]0-i am quite unable to account for the curious psychological fact , that it has become engraven on [my]0-i memory , while , at the time , [I]0-i was unconscious of listening to it . The pattern of the carpet , a particular curl of [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's " front , "[166-lady broadhem] the fact that the clock struck one , are all stamped upon the plate of [my]0-i internal perceptive faculties with the vividness of a photograph . The vision of happiness which [I]0-i had conjured up was changing into a hideous contrast , and reminded [me]0-i of the Diorama at the Colosseum in [my]0-i youth , where a fairy landscape , with a pastoral group at lunch in the foreground , became gradually converted into a pandemonium of flames and devils . [I]0-i felt borne along by a mighty torrent which was sweeping [me]0-i from [elysian fields]537-elysian fields into [some fathomless abyss]538-some fathomless abyss . Love and friendship both coming down together in one mighty crash , and the only thing left standing — [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem — right in front of [me]0-i — a very stern reality indeed . [I]0-i do n't the least know the length of time which elapsed between the end of [her]166-lady broadhem speech and when [I]0-i returned to consciousness — probably not many seconds , though it seemed an age . [I]0-i gasped for breath , so [she]166-lady broadhem kindly came to [my]0-i relief . " [[My]166-lady broadhem dear]1860-my dear [Lord Frank]116-lord frank , "[166-lady broadhem] [she]166-lady broadhem said , " after all it might have been worse . Now [he]110-grandon is quite capable of doing all [he]110-grandon can to help [you]116-lord frank with [Ursula]124-lady ursula . "[166-lady broadhem] [I]0-i groaned in spirit . " [I]0-i am so glad to think , [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , with a bitter laugh , " that [you]166-lady broadhem do not suspect [me]0-i of such a ridiculous exaggeration of sentiment . So far from it , it seems to impart a peculiar piquancy to the pursuit when success is only possible at the sacrifice of another 's happiness ; and when that other is [[one]301-one 's oldest friend]2176-one 's oldest friend , there is a refinement of emotion , a sort of pleasurable pain , which is quite irresistible . "[0-i] " To original sin , [I]166-lady broadhem am afraid , "[166-lady broadhem] said [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , looking down , for [my]0-i manner seemed to puzzle , and make [her]166-lady broadhem nervous . " Oh , it is not at all ' original , ' "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " Whatever other merit it possesses , it ca n't claim originality — it is the commonest thing in [the world]271-the world ; but [I]0-i think it is an acquired taste at first — it grows upon [you]2179-you like caviar or olives . "[0-i] At this crisis the demon of recklessness which had sustained [me]0-i , and prompted the above atrocious falsehood , deserted [me]0-i suddenly , so [I]0-i leant against the mantelpiece and sobbed aloud . "[166-lady broadhem] " Ah , [I]0-i see ; [you]0-i classify [us]2182-we somewhat in this way : first , if [you]0-i can get it , rich , orthodox , and white ; second , rich , heterdox , and white ; third , rich , orthodox , and black . Now , in [my]0-i opinion , to attach any importance whatever to colour is wicked . [My]0-i objections to [Mr Chundango]140-chundango do not apply to [his]140-chundango skin , which is as good as any other , but to [his]140-chundango heart , which [I]0-i am afraid is black . [I]0-i prefer a pure heart in a dark skin to a black heart in a white one , "[0-i] and [I]0-i looked significantly at [[her]541-her ladyship]2136-her ladyship . "[0-i] " [I]166-lady broadhem should insist upon [Ursula]124-lady ursula 's marrying [Mr Chundango]140-chundango . "[166-lady broadhem] At this moment the luncheon was announced . [I]0-i followed [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem mechanically towards [the dining - room]355-the dining - room , but instead of entering [it]355-the dining - room went up - stairs like one in a dream , and ordered [[my]0-i servant]544-my servant to make arrangements for [my]0-i immediate departure . [I]0-i pulled an arm - chair near [[my]0-i bedroom fire]545-my bedroom fire , and gazed hopelessly into [it]545-my bedroom fire . [People]293-people call [me]0-i odd . [I]0-i wonder really whether the conflicts of which [my]0-i brain is [the occasional arena]547-the occasional arena are fiercer than those of others . [I]0-i wonder whether [other people]548-other people 's thoughts are as like clouds as [mine]0-i are — sometimes , when it is stormy , grouping [themselves]548-other people in wild fantastic forms ; sometimes chasing each other through vacancy , for no apparent purpose ; sometimes melting away in " intense inane ; "[548-other people] and again consolidating [themselves]548-other people , black and lowering , till [they]548-other people burst in a passionate explosion . What are [they]548-other people doing now ? and [I]0-i tried in vain to stop the mental kaleidoscope which shifted itself so rapidly that [I]0-i could not catch one combination of thought before it was succeeded by another ; but always [the same prominent figures dodging madly about the chambers of [my]0-i brain]549-the same prominent figures dodging madly about the chambers of my brain — [Chundango]140-chundango , [Ursula]124-lady ursula , [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , and [Grandon]110-grandon ; [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , [Chundango]140-chundango , [Grandon]110-grandon , and [Ursula]124-lady ursula — backwards and forwards , forwards and backwards , like some horrid word that [I]0-i had to spell in a game of letters , and could never bring right . Love , friendship , hate , pity , admiration , treachery — more words to spell , ever combining wrongly , and never letting [me]0-i rest , till [I]0-i thought something must crack under the strain . Then mockingly came a voice ringing in [my]0-i ears — Peace , peace , peace — and [I]0-i fancied [myself]0-i lulled to rest in [her]550-her arms , and [I]0-i heard the cooing of doves mingle with the soft murmur of [her]550-her voice as [she]550-her leant wistfully over [me]0-i , and [I]0-i revelled in that most fatal of all nightmares — the nightmare of those who , perishing of hunger and thirst , die of imaginary banquets . " Sweet illusion , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " dear to [me]0-i as reality , brood over [my]0-i troubled spirit , deaden its pain , heal its wounds , and weave around [my]0-i being this delicious spell for ever . "[0-i] Then suddenly , as though [my]0-i brain had been a magazine into which a spark had fallen , it blazed up ; [my]0-i hair bristled , and drops stood upon [my]0-i forehead , for a great fear had fallen upon [me]0-i . It had invaded [me]0-i with the force of an overwhelming torrent , carrying all before it . [It]551-it said , " Whence is the calm that soothes [you]0-i ? [Infatuated dreamer]2189-infatuated dreamer , think [you]0-i it is the subsiding of the storm , and not rather the lull that precedes it ? Beware of the sleep of the frozen , from which there is no waking . "[551-it] What was this ? was [my]0-i mind regaining its balance , or was it going to lose it for ever ? Most horrid doubt ! the very thought was so much in the scale on the wrong side . Oh for something to lean upon — some strong stay of common - sense to support [me]0-i ! [I]0-i yearned for the practical — some fact on which to build . " [I]0-i have got it , "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed suddenly . " There must be some osseous matter behind [my]0-i dura mater ! "[0-i] [I]0-i shall never forget the consolation which this notion gave [me]0-i : it relieved [me]0-i from any further psychological responsibility , so to speak ; [I]0-i gave up mental analysis . [I]0-i attributed the keen susceptibility of [my]0-i — sthetic nature to this cause , and accepted it as [I]0-i would the gout , without a murmur . Still [I]0-i needed repose and solitude , so [I]0-i determined to go to [Flityville]29-flityville and arrange [my]0-i ideas , no longer alarmed at the confusion in which they were , but with the steadfast purpose of disentangling them quietly , as [I]0-i would an interesting knot . Hitherto [I]0-i had been tearing at it madly and making it worse ; now [I]0-i had got the end of the skein—"osseous matter"—and[0-i] would soon unravel it . So [I]0-i descended calmly to [the drawing - room]331-the drawing - room . [I]0-i found [it]331-the drawing - room empty , but it occurred to [me]0-i [I]0-i had left [my]0-i letter to [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula in [the recess]553-the recess , and in the agitation attending [my]0-i interview with [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , had forgotten to go back for it . [I]0-i pushed back the portière , and saw seated at the writing - table [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula [herself]124-lady ursula . [She]124-lady ursula looked pale and nervous , while [I]0-i felt overwhelmed with confusion and embarrassment . This was the more trying , as many years have elapsed since [I]0-i have experienced any such sensations . " Oh , [you]124-lady ursula do n't happen to have seen a letter lying about anywhere , do [you]124-lady ursula , [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " It ought to be under [your]124-lady ursula hand , for [I]0-i left it exactly on that spot . "[0-i] " No , "[124-lady ursula] [she]124-lady ursula said ; " [I]124-lady ursula found [mamma]1938-mamma writing here when [I]124-lady ursula came , and [she]1938-mamma took a packet of letters away with [her]1938-mamma ; perhaps [she]1938-mamma put [yours]0-i among them by mistake . [She]1938-mamma will be back from [her]1938-mamma drive almost immediately . "[124-lady ursula] " [I]0-i hope so , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [I]124-lady ursula should be sorry to leave without seeing [her]1938-mamma . "[124-lady ursula] " To leave , [Lord Frank]116-lord frank ! [I]124-lady ursula thought [you]0-i were going to stay till Monday . "[124-lady ursula] [She]124-lady ursula looked up rather appealingly , [I]0-i thought , as if [my]0-i presence would have been a satisfaction to [her]124-lady ursula under the circumstances ; and [I]0-i saw , as [I]0-i returned [her]124-lady ursula steady earnest gaze , that [she]124-lady ursula little guessed the purport of the missing letter . At that moment [my]0-i head began to swim , and the figures to dance about in [my]0-i brain again . [Chundango]140-chundango and [Grandon]110-grandon seemed locked in a death - struggle , and [Ursula]124-lady ursula , with dishevelled hair , trying to separate [them]554-them , while [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , in the background , was clapping [her]166-lady broadhem hands and urging them on . [I]0-i seemed spinning round [the group]555-the group with such rapidity that [I]0-i was obliged to steady [myself]0-i with one hand against the back of [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula 's chair . " What 's the matter ? what 's the matter , [Lord Frank]116-lord frank ? "[124-lady ursula] [she]124-lady ursula exclaimed . " Osseous matter , osseous matter , "[124-lady ursula] [I]0-i murmured mechanically , and it sounded so like an echo of [her]124-lady ursula words that [I]0-i am sure [she]124-lady ursula thought [me]0-i going mad . Should [I]0-i throw [myself]0-i at [her]124-lady ursula feet and tell [her]124-lady ursula all ? If [she]124-lady ursula would only trample upon [me]0-i and [my]0-i feelings together , it would be a luxury compared to the agony of self - control [I]0-i was inflicting upon [myself]0-i . If [I]0-i could only pour [myself]0-i out in a torrent of passionate expression , and wind up with a paroxysm of tears , [she]124-lady ursula was welcome to treat [me]0-i as [a raving lunatic]556-a raving lunatic , but [I]0-i should be much less likely to become one . But how , knowing what [I]0-i did , could [I]0-i face [Grandon]110-grandon afterwards ? Before that fatal conversation with [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , [I]0-i should have had the satisfaction of hearing [my]0-i fate from [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula [herself]124-lady ursula , and [I]0-i know that [she]124-lady ursula would have treated [me]0-i so tenderly that rejection would have been a thousand times preferable to this . [She]124-lady ursula would have known then the intensity of [my]0-i affection , [she]124-lady ursula would have heard from [my]0-i own lips the burning words with which [I]0-i would have pleaded [my]0-i cause , and , whatever might have been the result , would have pitied and felt for [me]0-i . Now , if [I]0-i say nothing , and [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem tells [her]124-lady ursula when [I]0-i am gone that [she]166-lady broadhem considers [us]557-us engaged , what will [Ursula]124-lady ursula think of [me]0-i ? Again , if [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem thinks [I]0-i am really going to do what [my]0-i conscience urges , and sacrifice [myself]0-i for [Grandon]110-grandon , then , [poor girl]558-poor girl , [she]558-poor girl will be sacrificed to [Chundango]140-chundango . Nothing but misery will come out of that double event : if [I]0-i do what is right , it will bring misery ; if [I]0-i do what is wrong , it will bring misery too,—that is one consolation — it makes the straight and narrow path easier . The only difficulty is , [I]0-i ca n't find it — and standing here with [my]0-i hand on [her]124-lady ursula chair , [my]0-i head swimming , and [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula looking anxiously up at [me]0-i , [I]0-i am not likely to find it . " [Lord Frank]116-lord frank , do let [me]124-lady ursula ring the bell and send for a glass of water , "[124-lady ursula] [she]124-lady ursula said at last . " Thanks , no ; the fact is , that letter [I]124-lady ursula have lost causes [me]124-lady ursula the greatest anxiety , and when [I]124-lady ursula thought what the consequences might be of its going astray [I]124-lady ursula felt a little faint for a moment . "[124-lady ursula] " Dear [me]124-lady ursula , "[124-lady ursula] said [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula , kindly , " [I]124-lady ursula will make [mamma]1938-mamma look for it at once , and [I]124-lady ursula am sure if it is a matter in which [my]124-lady ursula sympathy could be of any use , [you]116-lord frank will appreciate [my]124-lady ursula motive in offering it ; but [I]124-lady ursula do think in [this world]2116-this world [people]293-people might be of so much more use to [each other]320-each other than [they]293-people are , if [they]293-people would only trust [one another]2195-one another , and believe in the sincerity of friendship . Although [you]116-lord frank did try to shock [me]124-lady ursula last night , "[124-lady ursula] [she]124-lady ursula said , with a smile , " [I]124-lady ursula have heard so much of [you]116-lord frank from [Lord Grandon]110-grandon , and know how kind and good [you]116-lord frank are , although [he]110-grandon says [you]116-lord frank are too enthusiastic and too fond of paradoxes , but [I]124-lady ursula assure [you]116-lord frank [I]124-lady ursula consider [you]116-lord frank quite [an old friend]2196-an old friend . [You]116-lord frank remember , years ago , when [I]124-lady ursula was [a little girl]2197-a little girl , how [you]116-lord frank used to gallop about with [me]124-lady ursula on [my]124-lady ursula pony in [the park]2198-the park at [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem ? [You]116-lord frank wo n't think [me]124-lady ursula inquisitive , [I]124-lady ursula am sure , in saying this , but there are moments sometimes when it is a relief to find [a listener]322-a listener to the history of one 's troubles . "[124-lady ursula] " But when , by a curious fatality , [that listener]2200-that listener is the cause of [them]2201-them all , these moments are not likely to arrive , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , but did not say . Is it not enough to love [a woman]1960-a woman to distraction , and be obliged by every principle of honour to conceal it from [her]1960-a woman , without [her]1960-a woman pressing upon [you]560-you [her]1960-a woman sympathy , and inviting [your]560-you confidence ? and the very tenderness which had prompted [her]1960-a woman speech rose up against [her]1960-a woman in judgment in [my]0-i mind . So ready with [her]1960-a woman friendship , too ! Should [I]0-i tell [her]1960-a woman bitterly that [she]1960-a woman was [the only being in [the whole world]562-the whole world whose friendship could aggravate [my]0-i misery]561-the only being in the whole world whose friendship could aggravate my misery ? Should [I]0-i congratulate [her]1960-a woman upon the ingenuity [she]1960-a woman had displayed in thus torturing [me]0-i ? or should [I]0-i revenge [myself]0-i by giving [her]1960-a woman the confidence [she]1960-a woman asked , and requesting [her]1960-a woman to advise [me]0-i how to act under the circumstances ? Then [I]0-i looked at the gentle earnest face , and [my]0-i heart melted . [My]0-i troubles ! Do [I]0-i not know too well what [hers]1960-a woman are ? Perhaps it would be a relief to [her]1960-a woman to hear , that if worse comes to worst , [she]1960-a woman can always escape [Chundango]140-chundango by falling back upon [me]0-i . If [she]1960-a woman is driven to begging [me]0-i to offer [myself]0-i up on [[her]1960-a woman shrine]563-her shrine , what a very willing sacrifice [she]1960-a woman would find [me]0-i ! As [she]1960-a woman knows that [I]0-i must have overheard what passed between [her]1960-a woman and [Chundango]140-chundango this morning , shall [I]0-i make a counter - proposition of mutual confidence , and allude delicately to that most painful episode ! If [she]1960-a woman is generous enough to forget [her]1960-a woman own troubles and think of [me]0-i , why should not [I]0-i forget [mine]0-i and think of [her]1960-a woman ? The idea of this contradiction in terms struck [me]0-i as so exquisitely ludicrous , that [I]0-i laughed aloud . " Ha ! ha ! ha ! [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula , if [you]124-lady ursula only knew what a comic aspect that last kind speech of [yours]124-lady ursula has given to the whole affair . Do n't think [me]0-i ungrateful or rude , but — ha ! ha ! ha ! "[0-i] Here [I]0-i went off again . " When once [my]0-i sense of humour is really touched , [I]0-i always seem to see the point of a joke to quite a painful degree . Upon two occasions [I]0-i have suffered from fits after punning , and riddles always make [me]0-i hysterical ; but [I]0-i assure [you]124-lady ursula , [you]124-lady ursula unconsciously made a joke just now when [you]124-lady ursula asked [me]0-i to tell [you]124-lady ursula exactly what [I]0-i felt , which [I]0-i shall remember as long as [I]0-i live , for it will certainly be the death of [me]0-i — ha ! ha ! ha ! "[0-i] But [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula had risen from [her]124-lady ursula chair and rung the bell before [I]0-i had finished [my]0-i speech , and [I]0-i was still laughing when [the servant]564-the servant came into [the room]2119-the room , followed by [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem and [Lady Bridget]150-lady bridget . " [Dear]521-dear [me]166-lady broadhem , "[166-lady broadhem] said [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , with [her]166-lady broadhem most winning smile , " how very merry [you]124-lady ursula are!—at least [Lord Frank]116-lord frank is . Trust in [me]0-i , [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , taking [her]124-lady ursula hand affectionately , " and promise [me]0-i [you]124-lady ursula will not ask [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula what [I]0-i have just told [her]124-lady ursula ; if [you]124-lady ursula do , "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered , " [you]124-lady ursula will spoil all , "[0-i] and [I]0-i looked happy and mysterious . [I]0-i know [I]0-i can trust [you]124-lady ursula . [You]124-lady ursula have seen me"—and[0-i] [I]0-i formed the word with [my]0-i lips rather than uttered it with [my]0-i breath—"MAD ! Hush ! "[0-i] for [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula gave a quick exclamation , and almost fainted with alarm ; " [I]124-lady ursula am [myself]124-lady ursula again now . Remember [my]124-lady ursula happiness is in [your]124-lady ursula keeping"—this[124-lady ursula] out loud for [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's benefit . " [I]124-lady ursula am going to say good - bye to [Lady Dickiefield]151-lady dickiefield , and [you]124-lady ursula shall hear from [me]124-lady ursula when [I]124-lady ursula can receive [you]124-lady ursula at [Flityville]29-flityville . "[124-lady ursula] [I]0-i am endowed with a somewhat remarkable faculty , which [I]0-i have not been in the habit of alluding to , partly because [[my]0-i friends]305-my friends think [me]0-i ridiculous if [I]0-i do , and partly because [I]0-i never could see any use in it , but [I]0-i do nevertheless possess the power of seeing in the dark . Not after the manner of cats — the objects which actually exist — but images which sometimes appear as the condensations of a white misty - looking substance , and sometimes take a distinctly bright luminous appearance . As [I]0-i gaze into absolute darkness , [I]0-i first see a cloud , which gradually seems to solidify into a shape , either of an animal or some definite object . In the case of the more brilliant image , the appearance is immediate and evanescent . It comes and goes like a flash , and the subject is generally significant and beautiful . Perhaps some of [[my]0-i readers]308-my readers may be familiar with this phenomenon , and may account for it as being the result of what [they]569-they call imagination , which is only putting the difficulty one step back ; or may adopt the wiser course which [I]0-i have followed , and not endeavour to account for it at all . Whatever be its origin , the fact remains , and [I]0-i only advert to it now , as it is the best illustration [I]0-i can think of to describe the mental process through which [I]0-i passed in [the train]570-the train on [my]0-i way to [Flityville]29-flityville . [My]0-i mind seemed at first a white mist — a blank sheet of paper . [My]0-i interview with [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula had produced this effect upon it . Gradually , and quite unconsciously to [myself]0-i , so far as any mental effort was concerned , [my]0-i thoughts seemed to condense into a definite plan of action ; now and then a brilliant idea would appear like a flash , and vanish sometimes before [I]0-i could catch it ; but in so far as the complication in which [Grandon]110-grandon , [Ursula]124-lady ursula , [the Broadhem family]571-the broadhem family , and [myself]0-i were concerned , [I]0-i seemed to see [my]0-i way , or at all events to feel sure that [my]0-i way would be shown to [me]0-i , if [I]0-i let [my]0-i inspirations guide [me]0-i . When once [one]301-one achieves this thorough confidence in [one]301-one 's inspirations , the journey of life becomes simplified . [You]574-you never wonder what is round the next corner , and begin to prepare for unknown contingencies ; but [you]574-you wait till the corner is turned , and the contingency arrives , and passively allow [your]574-you mind to crystallise itself into a plan of action . At this moment , of course , [I]0-i have no more notion what is going to happen to [me]0-i than [you]574-you have . Divest [your]574-you mind , [[my]0-i friend]265-my friend , that [I]0-i know anything more of the plot of this story of [my]0-i life which [you]574-you are reading than [you]574-you do . [I]0-i positively have not the slightest idea what either [I]0-i or any of [the ladies and gentlemen to whom [I]0-i have introduced [you]574-you]576-the ladies and gentlemen to whom i have introduced you are likely to do , or how it is all going to end . [I]0-i have told [you]574-you the mental process under which [I]0-i act ; and , of course , this is the mere record of those inspirations . Very often the most unlikely things occur to [me]0-i all of a sudden : thus , while [my]0-i mind was , as it were , trifling with the events which [I]0-i have recounted , and throwing them into a variety of combinations , it flashed upon [me]0-i in the most irrelevant manner that [I]0-i would send — 4000 anonymously to [the Bishop of [[London]5-london 's fund]578-london 's fund]577-the bishop of london 's fund . In another second the unconscious train of thought which led [me]0-i to this determination revealed itself . " Here , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " have [I]0-i been attacking [this poor colonial bishop]2214-this poor colonial bishop and [the Establishment to which [he]2214-this poor colonial bishop belongs]2215-the establishment to which he belongs , and what have [I]0-i given [him]2214-this poor colonial bishop in return ? [I]0-i expose the abuses of [his]2214-this poor colonial bishop theological and ecclesiastical system , but [I]0-i provide [him]2214-this poor colonial bishop with no remedy . [I]0-i fling one big stone at [the crystal palace in which Protestantism is shrivelling away]2216-the crystal palace in which protestantism is shrivelling away , and another big stone at [the crystal palace]2217-the crystal palace in which [Catholicism]38-catholicism is rotting , and [I]0-i offer [them]2218-them in exchange the cucumber - frame under which [I]0-i am [myself]0-i squatting uncomfortably . [I]0-i owe [them]2218-them an apology . Unfortunately [I]0-i have not yet found either [the man]2219-the man or the body of [men who do not prefer hard cash to an apology]2220-men who do not prefer hard cash to an apology — provided , of course , it be properly proportioned to the susceptibility of [their]2218-them feelings or the delicacy of [their]2218-them sense of honour . Fairly , now , "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [myself]0-i , " if it was put to [the Bench of [Bishops]2222-bishops]2221-the bench of bishops , would [they]580-they consider — 5000 sufficient to compensate [the Church]8-the church for the expressions [I]0-i made use of to one of [their]580-they order ? "[0-i] " More than sufficient , "[0-i] [myself]0-i replied . " Then [we]2223-we will make it four thousand . "[0-i] But the whole merit of the action lies in the anonymous , and so [nobody]579-nobody knows till [they]580-they read this who it was made that munificent donation . That [I]0-i should have afterwards changed [my]0-i mind , and answered the advertisement of [the committee]581-the committee , which appeared in the " agony "[581-the committee] column of the ' Times , ' who wanted to know how [I]0-i wished the money applied , by a request that it should be paid back to [my]0-i account at [the Bank]582-the bank , does not affect the question ; [I]0-i merely wished to show the nature of [my]0-i impulses , and the readiness with which [I]0-i act upon them . Some days elapsed after [my]0-i arrival at [Flityville]29-flityville before [I]0-i felt moved to write to [Grandon]110-grandon . The fact is , [I]0-i was writing this record of [my]0-i trials for [the world]271-the world in general , and did not know what to say to [him]110-grandon in particular . At length , feeling that [I]0-i owed [him]110-grandon an explanation , [I]0-i wrote as follows : — " [You]110-grandon are doubtless surprised , [[my]0-i dear fellow]2224-my dear fellow , "[0-i] [I]0-i began , " at [my]0-i turning [myself]0-i into [a hermit]2225-a hermit at this most inopportune season of the year ; but the fact is , that shortly after [you]110-grandon left [Dickiefield]120-dickiefield , [I]0-i became so deeply impressed with the responsibility of the great work [I]0-i had undertaken , that [I]0-i perceived that a period of retirement and repose was absolutely necessary with a view to the elaboration of some system which should enable [me]0-i to grapple with the great moral and social questions upon which [I]0-i am engaged . "[0-i] Diverting [my]0-i anxious gaze from [Christendom]26-christendom generally , [I]0-i concentrated it upon [[my]0-i own country]584-my own country , in the hope that [I]0-i might discover the root of its disease . Morbid activity of the national brain , utterly deranged action of the national heart . Those were the symptoms — unmistakable . Proximate cause also not difficult to arrive at . Due to the noxious influence of tall chimneys upon [broad acres]585-broad acres , whereby the commercial effluvium of [the Plutocracy]586-the plutocracy has impregnated the upper atmosphere , and overpowered the enfeebled and enervated faculties of [the aristocracy]587-the aristocracy ; lust of gain has supervened upon love of ease . Hence the utter absence of those noble and generous impulses which are the true indications of healthy national life . Expediency has taken the place of principle ; conscience has been crushed out of the system by calculation . The life - blood of [the country]1937-the country , instead of bounding along its veins , creeps sluggishly through them , till it threatens to stagnate altogether , and congestion becomes imminent . " Looked at from what [I]154-jonah may term ' externals , ' [we]2226-we simply present to [the world]271-the world at large the ignoble spectacle of [a nation of [usurers]2229-usurers]2228-a nation of usurers trembling over [our]2226-we money - bags ; looked at from internals , [I]154-jonah perceive that [we]2226-we are suffering from a moral opiate , to the action of which [I]154-jonah attribute the unhappy complaints that [I]154-jonah have endeavoured to describe . This pernicious narcotic has been absorbed by [us]2226-we for hundreds of years unsuspected and unperceived under the guise of a popular theology . [We]2226-we have become so steeped in the insane delusion , now many centuries old , that [we]2226-we are [a Christian nation]2230-a christian nation , that [I]154-jonah anticipate with dread the reaction which will take place when [men]1940-men awaken to the true character of the religious quackery with which [they]1940-men have been duped , and , overlooking in [their]1940-men frenzy the distinction which exists between ancient and modern Christianity , will repudiate the former with horror , which , after all , does not deserve to be condemned , for it has never yet been tried as a political system in [any country]2232-any country . [Individuals]2233-individuals only profess to be theoretically governed by it . Nor would it be possible , as society is at present constituted , for [any man]2234-any man to carry out [its]2234-any man principles in daily life . That [any statesman]2235-any statesman would be instantly ruined who should openly announce that [he]2235-any statesman intended to govern [the country]1937-the country on purely Christian principles , may be made clear to the simplest comprehension . For instance , imagine [[our]2226-we Foreign Minister]2237-our foreign minister getting up in [the House of Commons]1929-the house of commons and justifying [his]2237-our foreign minister last stroke of foreign policy upon the ground that [we]2226-we should ' love [[our]2226-we neighbours]2239-our neighbours better than [ourselves]2226-we , or penning a despatch to any power that [we]2226-we felt ' persecuted ' by blessing it . When do [we]2226-we even do good to [anybody]2240-anybody in [our]2226-we national capacity , much less to [them]2240-anybody ' that hate [us]2226-we ' ? [We]2226-we certainly pray like [Chinamen]2241-chinamen when [we]2226-we want to propitiate [an angry Deity about the cattle - plague]2242-an angry deity about the cattle - plague ; but who ever heard of ' a form of prayer to be used ' for nations ' who despitefully use [us]2226-we . ' Fancy [the Chancellor of the Exchequer]2243-the chancellor of the exchequer informing [us]2226-we that instead of laying up for [the nation]2056-the nation treasures upon [earth]2245-earth , [he]2243-the chancellor of the exchequer proposed realising all that [the country]1937-the country possessed and giving [it]1937-the country to [the poor]2247-the poor . [Christian Churchmen and [statesmen]2249-statesmen]2248-christian churchmen and statesmen do not therefore sufficiently believe in the power and efficacy of the Christian moral code to trust [the nation]2056-the nation to it alone . Hence [they]2248-christian churchmen and statesmen have invented ecclesiastical organisations and theological dogmas as anodynes ; and [the people]2251-the people have been lulled into security by the singular notion , that if [they]2251-the people supported [the one]2252-the one and professed to believe in the other , [they]2251-the people were different from either [Mohammedans]2253-mohammedans or [Bhuddists]152-bhuddists . In a word , it is the curse of [England]10-england that its intellect can see truths which its heart will not embody . The more [I]154-jonah think of it the more [I]154-jonah am disposed to risk the assertion , that if , as is supposed , the moral code called [Christian]153-christian is divine , it is only not practicable , literally , by [the nation]2056-the nation for lack of national heart - faith . [I]154-jonah tell [you]2255-you this in confidence , for [I]154-jonah am already considered so wild and visionary upon all these matters , and so thoroughly unsound , that [I]154-jonah should not like it to be generally known , for fear of its injuring [my]154-jonah political prospects . In the mean time it will very much assist [me]154-jonah in arriving at some of [my]154-jonah conclusions , if [you]2255-you will kindly procure for [me]154-jonah , from [any leading member of the Legislature , lay or clerical]2256-any leading member of the legislature , lay or clerical , answers to the following questions : — "[154-jonah] First , Whether [Jonah]154-jonah could possibly have had anything to say to [Nineveh]155-nineveh which would not apply with equal force to this Christian metropolis?—and if so , What ? " Second , Specify the sins which were probably committed in [Chorazin]40-chorazin or [Bethsaida]41-bethsaida , but which have not yet been perpetrated in [London]5-london . "[154-jonah] Third , As [statecraft ( assisted by priestcraft]589-statecraft ( assisted by priestcraft ) consists not in making [the State]590-the state better but richer , explain why it is easier for [a collection of [rich men]592-rich men — called [a nation]593-a nation]591-a collection of rich men — called a nation — to be saved , than for a camel to go through the eye of a needle , but not so easy for [one man]594-one man . " Fourth , Does the saying that the love of money is the root of all evil apply to [a nation]593-a nation as well as to [an individual?—and]2258-an individual?—and if not , how does it happen that the more [we]2259-we accumulate wealth , the more [we]2259-we increase poverty and misery and crime ? "[0-i] That is enough for the present . But oh ! what a string of questions [I]0-i could propound to [these stumbling pagans]595-these stumbling pagans , stupefied by the fatuous superstition that [[their]595-these stumbling pagans country]596-their country is safer than [other countries which have come to judgment , because [they]595-these stumbling pagans are called by a particular name]597-other countries which have come to judgment , because they are called by a particular name ! Is there among [them]595-these stumbling pagans all not the faintest consciousness of an impending doom ? or is the potency of the drug such that it is impossible to raise a cry loud enough to rouse [them]595-these stumbling pagans ? Why will [they]595-these stumbling pagans go on vainly trying to solve the impossible problem of Government , never seeing that whatever system is introduced is merely a rearrangement of [sinners]598-sinners ; that [voters]599-voters are like cards — the more [you]600-you shuffle [them]599-voters the dirtier [they]599-voters get ; and that it is of no use agitating for a reform in the franchise without first agitating for a reform in the consciences of [those who are to exercise it]601-those who are to exercise it , and in the fundamental principles of the policy upon which [we]602-we are to be governed . " Wisely saith [the greatest poet of the age]2260-the greatest poet of the age , as yet , alas ! unknown to fame : — "[422-my dear friend] Ah , [[my]0-i dear friend]422-my dear friend ! how often , from [my]0-i humble seat below [the gangway]604-the gangway , have [I]0-i gazed upon [the Treasury Bench]605-the treasury bench , and wondered how it was that [right hon]606-right hon . [gentlemen]607-gentlemen , struggling to retain [their]607-gentlemen dignity by sitting on [each other]320-each other 's knees , did not perceive that the reason why great reforms perpetually fail is , not because [they]595-these stumbling pagans have not [their]595-these stumbling pagans root in some radical injustice — not because the despotisms against which [they]595-these stumbling pagans rise are in [themselves]595-these stumbling pagans right — but because [those who attempt to inaugurate new and better conditions upon the surfaces of [society]297-society]609-those who attempt to inaugurate new and better conditions upon the surfaces of society are [themselves]609-those who attempt to inaugurate new and better conditions upon the surfaces of society , for the most part , desolate , darkened , and chaotic within ! [I]0-i am under the impression , therefore , that no reform - agitation will ever do good which is not preceded by an agitation , throughout the length and breadth of [the land]2059-the land , in favour of the introduction , for the first time , of this old original moral code , not merely into [the government of [the country]1937-the country]612-the government of the country , but into the life of [every individual]614-every individual . Unless that is done , and done speedily , [those who are now morally stupefied]615-those who are now morally stupefied will die in [their]615-those who are now morally stupefied torpor , and [the rest who are harmless lunatics]616-the rest who are harmless lunatics will become gibbering and shrieking demoniacs . — [I]0-i had become so absorbed by the train of considerations into which [I]0-i had been led , that [I]0-i never thought of mentioning to [Grandon]110-grandon the circumstances which attended [my]0-i departure from [Dickiefield]120-dickiefield . It was not until after [I]0-i had posted [my]0-i letter that it occurred to [me]0-i how singular , considering the last words which passed between [us]617-us , this silence would appear . If to be odd has its drawbacks , it also has its advantages ; and [I]0-i felt that [Grandon]110-grandon would be as unable to draw any conclusions from [my]0-i silence as from any other erratic act of [my]0-i life . After all , what could [I]0-i have said ? It will be time , [I]0-i thought , to venture upon that very delicate ground when [I]0-i get [his]110-grandon reply . But this [I]0-i was destined never to receive , and the questions [I]0-i had propounded are likely to remain unanswered , for on the very next day [I]0-i received the following telegram from [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem : — " [Your]0-i immediate presence here is absolutely necessary . Delay will be fatal . "[166-lady broadhem] [Mary Broadhem]156-mary broadhem . " [Grosvenor Square]42-grosvenor square , 20th March . "[156-mary broadhem] [Piccadilly]7-piccadilly , April . Considering the extent to which [I]0-i have been digressing , it will be perhaps desirable , before [I]0-i plunge again into the stormy current of [my]0-i narrative , to define in a few words what , in the language of diplomacy , is termed " the situation . "[156-mary broadhem] After [I]0-i have done so , [I]0-i shall feel much obliged if [you]618-you will kindly " grasp "[619-an old lady] it . Briefly , it is as follows : [I]0-i am telegraphed for in frantic terms by [an old lady]619-an old lady who is under the firm impression that [I]0-i am engaged to be married to [[her]619-an old lady daughter]566-her daughter . [I]0-i am violently in love with [that daughter]621-that daughter , but for certain reasons [I]0-i have felt it [my]0-i duty to account for [my]0-i extraordinary conduct by informing [her]619-an old lady confidentially that [I]0-i have occasional fits of temporary insanity . [That daughter]621-that daughter , [I]0-i am positively assured by [[her]621-that daughter mother]365-her mother , is no less violently attached to [[my]0-i most dear and intimate friend]624-my most dear and intimate friend . [[My]0-i most dear and intimate friend]624-my most dear and intimate friend returns the affection . [Mamma]157-mamma threatens that if [I]0-i do not marry [[her]157-mamma daughter]566-her daughter , rather than allow [[my]0-i most dear and intimate friend]624-my most dear and intimate friend to do so , [she]157-mamma will ally [the young lady]628-the young lady to [an affluent native of [Bombay]12-bombay]629-an affluent native of bombay . So much is known . On the following points [I]0-i am still in the dark : — First , What on earth does [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem mean by telling [me]0-i to come immediately , as delay may be fatal?—to whom ? to [me]0-i or to [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula , or [herself]124-lady ursula ? "[0-i] At that moment [I]0-i heard [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula 's voice in [the hall]642-the hall , and the rustle of [her]124-lady ursula dress as [she]124-lady ursula went up - [stairs]643-stairs . [She]166-lady broadhem was saying something to which [I]0-i was not attending , but now was suddenly paralysed and silenced as [I]0-i looked at [her]166-lady broadhem fixedly .
