"[0-i] It is impossible for [me]0-i to describe the intensity of the hatred which [I]0-i felt at this moment for [the woman who had caused [me]0-i for one second to think of [Ursula]124-lady ursula as a marketable commodity , who should be offered for purchase to [an Oriental adventurer]645-an oriental adventurer]644-the woman who had caused me for one second to think of ursula as a marketable commodity , who should be offered for purchase to an oriental adventurer . The only being [I]0-i despised more than [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem was myself;—because [she]166-lady broadhem chose to take [my]0-i angel off the pedestal on which [I]0-i had placed [her]124-lady ursula and throw [her]124-lady ursula into the dirt , was [I]0-i calmly to acquiesce in the proceeding ? The storm raging within [me]0-i seemed gradually to blind [me]0-i to external objects ; [my]0-i great love was battling with remorse , indignation , and despair ; and [I]0-i stood wavering and distracted , looking , as it were , within for rest and without for comfort , till the light seemed to leave [my]0-i eyes , and the fire which had flashed from them for a moment became suddenly extinguished . [I]0-i was recalled to consciousness by an exclamation from [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem . " Heavens , [Frank]116-lord frank , do n't stare so wildly — [you]116-lord frank quite frighten [me]166-lady broadhem ! [I]166-lady broadhem have only asked for [your]116-lord frank advice , and [you]116-lord frank make use of expressions and fly off in a manner which nothing but the excitability of [your]116-lord frank temperament can excuse . [I]166-lady broadhem assure [you]116-lord frank [I]166-lady broadhem am worried enough without having [my]166-lady broadhem cares added to by [your]116-lord frank unkindness . There , if [you]116-lord frank want to know the exact state of [my]166-lady broadhem affairs , look through [my]166-lady broadhem papers — [you]116-lord frank will find [I]166-lady broadhem am [a woman of business]2295-a woman of business ; and [I]166-lady broadhem have got an accurate list which [I]166-lady broadhem shall be able to explain . Of course all the more important original documents are at [[my]166-lady broadhem solicitor]466-my solicitor 's . "[166-lady broadhem] [I]0-i sat moodily down without answering this semi - conciliatory , semi - plaintive speech . [I]0-i did not even take the trouble to analyse it . [I]0-i felt morally and physically exhausted . The long journey , the suspense , and this dénouement , had prostrated [me]0-i . [I]0-i took up the papers [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem offered [me]0-i , and turned them vacantly over . [I]0-i read the list , but failed to attach any meaning to the items over which [my]0-i gaze listlessly wandered . [I]0-i felt that [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem was watching [me]0-i curiously , but every effort [I]0-i made to grasp the details before [me]0-i failed hopelessly . At last [I]0-i threw the packet down in despair , and , leaning over the table , clasped [my]0-i bursting forehead with [my]0-i hands . " [Dear Frank]164-frank , "[166-lady broadhem] said [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , and for the first time [her]166-lady broadhem voice betrayed signs of genuine emotion , " [I]166-lady broadhem know [I]166-lady broadhem have been very imprudent , but [I]166-lady broadhem did it all for the best . [You]164-frank can understand now why [I]166-lady broadhem hesitated to tell [you]164-frank everything at first . [You]164-frank do n't know how much it has cost [me]166-lady broadhem , and to what means [I]166-lady broadhem am obliged to resort to keep up [my]166-lady broadhem courage ; besides , [I]166-lady broadhem have got into such a habit of concealment that [I]166-lady broadhem could not bear that even [you]164-frank should know the desperate state of [our]2297-our affairs , though [I]166-lady broadhem had no idea that in so short a time [you]164-frank could have unravelled such complicated accounts and arrived at the terrible result . Perhaps [you]164-frank would like [me]166-lady broadhem to leave [you]164-frank for a few moments . [I]166-lady broadhem will go and say good - night to [Ursula]124-lady ursula , whom [I]166-lady broadhem heard going up - [stairs]643-stairs just now . "[166-lady broadhem] [I]0-i heard [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem leave [the room]2119-the room , but did not raise [my]0-i head , and indeed only slowly comprehended the purport of [her]166-lady broadhem last speech . As it dawned upon [me]0-i , the hopelessness of the whole situation seemed to overwhelm [me]0-i . Chaos and ruin like [gaunt spectres]647-gaunt spectres stared [me]0-i in the face ! What mattered it if [the Broadhem family]571-the broadhem family were bankrupt in estate , if [I]0-i was to become bankrupt in mind ? What matter if [they]571-the broadhem family lost all [their]571-the broadhem family worldly possessions ? Had [I]0-i not lost all hope of [Ursula]124-lady ursula since [I]0-i had heard of [her]124-lady ursula attachment to [Grandon]110-grandon , and with [her]124-lady ursula every generous impulse of [my]0-i nature ? Why should [I]0-i save [the family]494-the family , even if [I]0-i could ? Why in [this desert of [my]0-i existence]650-this desert of my existence spend a fortune on [an oasis [I]0-i was forbidden ever to enter or enjoy]651-an oasis i was forbidden ever to enter or enjoy ? Why should [I]0-i bring offerings to [the shrine at which [I]0-i might never worship]652-the shrine at which i might never worship ? [The whole temple that enclosed [it]653-the whole temple that enclosed it]653-the whole temple that enclosed it was tottering . Instead of helping to prop it up , why not , like [Samson]165-samson , drag [it]653-the whole temple that enclosed it down and let [it]653-the whole temple that enclosed it bury [me]0-i in its ruin ? [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i on the couch from which [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem had risen , and , turning [my]0-i face to the wall , longed with an intense desire for an eternal release . At that moment [my]0-i hand , which [I]0-i had thrust under the pillow , came in contact with something hard and cold . [I]0-i drew it out , and was startled to find that it was a small vial labelled " POISON . "[0-i] [I]0-i am not naturally superstitious , but this immediate response to [my]0-i thoughts seemed an indication so direct as to be almost supernatural . [I]0-i had hardly framed in definite terms the idea of a suicide which should at once end [my]0-i agony , when the means thereto were actually placed in [my]0-i very hand . Even had [I]0-i doubted , the inward sense , the inspiration to which [I]0-i trust , and which has never yet failed [me]0-i , said , Drink ! It even whispered aloud , Drink ! From every corner of [the room]2119-the room came soft pleasant murmurs of the same word . Beautiful sirens floating round [me]0-i bade [me]0-i drink . Every thought of moral evil vanished in connection with this final act . [I]0-i looked forward with rapture to the long sleep before [me]0-i , and with a smile of the most intense and fervent gratitude [I]0-i raised the bottle to [my]0-i lips . [I]0-i remember thinking at the moment , " The smile is very important — it shall play upon [my]0-i lips to the end . [Ursula]124-lady ursula , [I]0-i die happy , for [my]0-i last thought is , that in the spirit [I]0-i shall soon revisit [thee]124-lady ursula , "[0-i] and the liquid trickled slowly down [my]0-i throat . It was not until [I]0-i had drained the last drop that [I]0-i suddenly recognised the taste . It was the " pick - [me]0-i - up "[0-i] [I]0-i always get at [Harris 's]44-harris 's , [the apothecary in [St James 's Street]45-st james 's street]655-the apothecary in st james 's street , when [my]0-i fit of nervous exhaustion come on , but there seemed rather more of the spirituous ingredient in it than usual . The life - stream began to tingle back through all [my]0-i fibres — [my]0-i miseries took grotesque forms . " Ha ! ha ! "[0-i] And [I]0-i took up the papers with a hand rapidly becoming steady , and glanced over them with an eye no longer confused and dim . "[2136-her ladyship] A glance of very evil meaning shot across [[her]661-her ladyship]2136-her ladyship 's eyes as they met [mine]664-mine after this speech , but [I]0-i frightened it away by the savageness of [my]0-i gaze , till [she]2136-her ladyship was literally obliged to put [her]2136-her ladyship hand up to [her]2136-her ladyship forehead . The crisis was exciting [me]0-i , for [Ursula]124-lady ursula was at stake , and it was just possible [my]0-i conditions might be refused ; but [I]0-i felt the magnetism of [my]0-i will concentrating itself in [my]0-i eyes as if they were burning - glasses . It seemed to dash itself upon the reefs and barriers of [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's rocky nature ; the inner forces of [[our]665-our organisms]666-our organisms were engaged in a decisive struggle for the mastery ; but the field of battle was in [her]166-lady broadhem , not in [me]0-i . [I]0-i had invaded [[the enemy]667-the enemy 's country]668-the enemy 's country , and [[her]166-lady broadhem frontier]669-her frontier was as long and difficult to defend as ours is in [Canada]50-canada . So [I]0-i kept on pouring in [mesmeric reinforcements]670-mesmeric reinforcements , as [she]166-lady broadhem sat with [her]166-lady broadhem head bent , and [her]166-lady broadhem whole moral being in turmoil . Never before had [any man]2234-any man ventured to dictate to [this veteran campaigner]672-this veteran campaigner . [The late Lord]673-the late lord had been accustomed to regard [her]166-lady broadhem as infallible , and [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem has not yet known the pleasures of independence . [She]166-lady broadhem never had [friends]674-friends who were not servile , or permitted [herself]166-lady broadhem to be contradicted , except by [a few privileged ecclesiastics , and then only in unctuous and deprecatory tones]675-a few privileged ecclesiastics , and then only in unctuous and deprecatory tones . That [I]0-i , of whom [the world]271-the world was accustomed to speak in terms of compassion , and whom [she]166-lady broadhem inwardly despised at this moment , should stand over [her]166-lady broadhem more unyielding and imperious than [herself]166-lady broadhem , caused [her]166-lady broadhem to experience a sensation nearly allied to suffocation . [I]0-i seemed instinctively to follow the mental processes through which [she]166-lady broadhem was passing , and a certain consciousness that [I]0-i did so demoralised [her]166-lady broadhem . Now , [I]0-i felt , [she]166-lady broadhem is going to take [me]0-i to task in a " sweet Christian spirit "[166-lady broadhem] about the state of [my]0-i soul , and [I]0-i brought up " will "[0-i] reinforcements which [I]0-i poured down upon [her]166-lady broadhem brain through the parting of [her]166-lady broadhem front , till [she]166-lady broadhem backed suddenly out of the position , and took up a hostile , [I]0-i might almost say an abusive , attitude . Here again [I]0-i met [her]166-lady broadhem with such a shower of invective , " uttered not , yet comprehended , "[0-i] that after a silent contest [she]166-lady broadhem gave this up too , and finally fell back on the flat rejection of [me]0-i and [my]0-i money altogether . This , [I]0-i confess , was the critical moment . [She]166-lady broadhem took [her]166-lady broadhem hand down when [she]166-lady broadhem came to this mental resolution , and [she]166-lady broadhem looked at [me]0-i , [I]0-i thought , but it might have been imagination , demoniacally . What had [I]0-i to oppose to it ? [My]0-i love for [Ursula]124-lady ursula ? No ; that would soften [me]0-i . [My]0-i aversion to [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem ? No ; for it was not so great as [hers]166-lady broadhem for [me]0-i . For a moment [I]0-i wavered ; [my]0-i will seemed paralysed ; [her]166-lady broadhem gaze was becoming fascinating , while mine was getting clouded , till a mist seemed to conceal [her]166-lady broadhem from [me]0-i altogether . And now , at the risk of being misunderstood and ridiculed , [I]0-i feel bound to describe exactly the most remarkable occurrence of [my]0-i life . At that moment [I]0-i saw distinctly , in the luminous haze which surrounded [me]0-i , a fiery cross . [I]0-i have already said that [objects of this kind]677-objects of this kind often appeared to [me]0-i in the dark , apropos of nothing ; but upon no former occasion had [a lighted room]678-a lighted room become dim , and a vision manifested itself within which seemed to answer to the involuntary invocation for assistance that [I]0-i made when [I]0-i found the powers of [my]0-i own will beginning utterly to fail [me]0-i ; and , what was still more strange , never before had any such manifestation effected an immediate revolution in [my]0-i sentiments . Up to that moment [I]0-i had been internally fierce and overbearing in [my]0-i resolution to subdue the nature with which [I]0-i was contending , and [I]0-i was actually defeated when [I]0-i received this supernatural indication of assistance . Before the dazzling vision had vanished , it had conveyed its lesson of self - sacrifice , and created within [me]0-i a new impulse , under the influence of which [I]0-i solemnly vowed that if [I]0-i triumphed now [I]0-i should use [my]0-i victory for the good not only of those [I]0-i loved , but of [her]679-i then sitting before [me]0-i . [The demon of [my]0-i own nature , which had evidently been struggling with [the demon of [hers]679-i]681-the demon of hers]680-the demon of my own nature , which had evidently been struggling with the demon of hers , suddenly deserted [me]0-i , and [his]680-the demon of my own nature , which had evidently been struggling with the demon of hers place seemed occupied by [an angel of light]682-an angel of light , furnishing [me]0-i with the powers of exorcism , which were to be gained only at the sacrifice of self . [My]0-i very breath seemed instantly charged with prayers for [her]679-i , at the moment [I]0-i felt [she]679-i regarded [me]0-i with loathing and hate . An ineffable calm pervaded [my]0-i whole being . A sense of happiness and gratitude deprived the consciousness of the conquest which [I]0-i had gained of any sentiment of exultation ; on the contrary , [I]0-i felt gentle and subdued [myself]0-i — anxious to soothe and comfort [her]679-i with that consolation [I]0-i had just experienced . Ah , [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem ! at that moment , had [I]0-i not been in the presence of [a " saint]2376-a " saint , "[0-i] [I]0-i should have fallen upon [my]0-i knees . Perhaps as it was [I]0-i might have done so , had [she]679-i not suddenly leant back exhausted . " [Frank]164-frank , "[679-i] [she]679-i said , " [I]679-i seem to have been dreaming . [I]679-i am subject to fits of violent nervous depression , and the agitation of this scene has completely overcome [me]679-i ; [my]679-i brain seems stunned , and all [my]679-i faculties have become torpid . [I]679-i can think of nothing more now , do what [you]164-frank like ; all [I]679-i want is to go to sleep . If [you]164-frank ring the bell in [that corner]2377-that corner , [Jenkins]173-jenkins will come down . Good - night ; [I]679-i shall see [you]164-frank to - morrow . Take the papers with [you]164-frank . "[679-i] [I]0-i took [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's hand — it was cold and clammy — and held it till [[her]166-lady broadhem maid]683-her maid came down . [She]166-lady broadhem had already fallen into a half - mesmeric sleep , but was not conscious of [her]166-lady broadhem condition . [I]0-i saw [her]166-lady broadhem safely on [her]166-lady broadhem way to [[her]166-lady broadhem bedroom]2267-her bedroom on the arm of [[her]166-lady broadhem maid]683-her maid , and left [the house]2095-the house with [my]0-i pockets full of papers , more fresh and invigorated than [I]0-i had felt for weeks . A new light had indeed dawned upon [me]0-i . For the first time one of these " hallucinations , "[687-medical men] as [medical men]687-medical men usually term them , to which [I]0-i am subject , had contained a lesson . Not only had [I]0-i profited from it upon the spot , but it had suggested to [me]0-i an entirely new line of conduct in the great question which most nearly affected [my]0-i own happiness , and seemed to guarantee [me]0-i the strength of will and moral courage which should enable [me]0-i to carry it out . As [I]0-i walked [home]330-home , with the piercing March wind cutting [me]0-i through , solemn thoughts and earnest aspirations arose within [me]0-i , and , struggling into existence amid the wreck that seemed to strew the disturbed chambers of [my]0-i brain , came the prayer of [an old saint , which , in years gone by]689-an old saint , which , in years gone by , had fixed itself permanently in some vacant niche of [my]0-i mind : — Time alone will show whether the project [I]0-i formed under the new influences which were now controlling [me]0-i , will ever be realised . There is one point which [I]0-i have in common with [Archimedes,—my]174-archimedes,—my most brilliant inspirations very often come to [me]0-i in [[my]0-i tub]690-my tub , or while [I]0-i am dressing . On the morning following the scene above described , [I]0-i trusted to this moment to furnish [me]0-i with an idea which should enable [me]0-i to put [my]0-i plan into operation , but [I]0-i sought in vain . In the first place , though [I]0-i assumed in the presence of [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem a thorough knowledge of the peculiar description of the transaction in which [she]166-lady broadhem was engaged , [I]0-i feel bound not to conceal from [[my]0-i readers]308-my readers that [I]0-i have made it a rule through life to confine [my]0-i knowledge of business strictly to theory , and though [I]0-i am as thoroughly conversant with the terms of the Stock Exchange as with the language of [the swell mob]692-the swell mob , [I]0-i avoid , in ordinary life , making use either of one or the other . Hence [I]0-i have always treated debentures , stock , scrip , coupons , and all the jargon connected with such money - making and money - losing contrivances , as pertaining to the abstract science of finance ; nor do [I]0-i ever desire to know anything of them practically , feeling assured that the information thus acquired is of a character calculated to exercise an injurious influence upon the moral nature . [I]0-i do not for a moment wish to reflect upon [those honest individuals who devote [their]693-those honest individuals who devote their whole lives to the acquisition of money and nothing else whole lives to the acquisition of money and nothing else]693-those honest individuals who devote their whole lives to the acquisition of money and nothing else . Had [one of [[my]0-i own ancestors]695-my own ancestors]694-one of my own ancestors not done so , [I]0-i should not now be [the millionaire [I]0-i am]696-the millionaire i am , and able to write thus of the pursuit of wealth . But let [no man]697-no man tell [me]0-i that the supreme indifference to it which [I]0-i entertain , does not place [me]0-i upon a higher platform than [a gold - hunter]698-a gold - hunter can possibly aspire to . When , therefore , [I]0-i looked forward to an interview with [the Honourable Spiffington Goldtip]175-the honourable spiffington goldtip , [I]0-i felt that [I]0-i incurred a very serious responsibility . Not being versed in the Capel Court standard of morality , or being in the habit of treading those delicate lines upon which [Spiffy]159-spiffy had learnt to balance [himself]159-spiffy so gracefully , [I]0-i might , instead of doing [him]159-spiffy good , be the means of encouraging [him]159-spiffy in that pecuniary scramble which enabled [him]159-spiffy to gain a precarious livelihood . " After all , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , " why not hover about [the City]1952-the city with [one]301-one 's hands full of gold , as one used to after dinner at [Greenwich]51-greenwich , when showers of copper delighted [the ragged crowd beneath]2380-the ragged crowd beneath , and have the fun of seeing [all the mud - larking Spiffys]2381-all the mud - larking spiffys , [fashionable and snobbish]2382-fashionable and snobbish , scrambling in wild confusion , and rolling fraternally over [each other in the dirt]2383-each other in the dirt ? If [I]0-i ca n't convert [them]2381-all the mud - larking spiffys , if [I]0-i must be ' done ' by [them]2381-all the mud - larking spiffys , [I]0-i will ' do ' to [them]2381-all the mud - larking spiffys as [I]0-i would be ' done ' by ; and rather than leave [them]2381-all the mud - larking spiffys to perish , will adopt an extreme measure , and keep on suffocating [them]2381-all the mud - larking spiffys with the mud [they]2381-all the mud - larking spiffys delight to revel in , till [they]2381-all the mud - larking spiffys cry aloud for help . What a pleasure it would be to wash [Spiffy]159-spiffy all over afterwards , and start [him]159-spiffy fresh and sweet in a new line of life ! "[0-i] As [I]0-i said before , [I]0-i was in [my]0-i tub [myself]0-i as [I]0-i made this appropriate reflection ; then [my]0-i thoughts involuntarily reverted to [Chundango]140-chundango . When [I]0-i had threatened [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem with the mercenary spirit of [that distinguished Oriental]699-that distinguished oriental , [I]0-i inwardly doubted whether , indeed , it were possible for [her]166-lady broadhem to propose any pecuniary sacrifice which [he]140-chundango was not prepared to make , in order to gain the social prize upon which [he]140-chundango had set [his]140-chundango heart ; and [I]0-i dreaded lest [I]0-i should have driven [her]166-lady broadhem in despair to have recourse to this " dark "[166-lady broadhem] alternative,—whether , in order to save [the Broadhem family]571-the broadhem family from ruin and disgrace — for [I]0-i suspected that the papers [I]0-i had carried away contained evidence that [the one]2252-the one was as possible as the other — [Ursula]124-lady ursula would accede to the pressure of [the family]494-the family generally , and of [[her]124-lady ursula mother]365-her mother in particular , whose wish none of [[her]365-her mother children]704-her children had ever dared to thwart , was a consideration which caused [me]0-i acute anxiety . [I]0-i must prepare [myself]0-i shortly for a conversation on the subject with [Grandon]110-grandon . What should [I]0-i say to [him]110-grandon ? Granting that the means occasionally justify the end , which [I]0-i do not admit , what would be the use of making a false statement either in the sense that [I]0-i was , or that [I]0-i was not , going to marry [Ursula]124-lady ursula ? If [I]0-i said [I]0-i was , [he]110-grandon would think [me]0-i [a traitor]705-a traitor and [her]124-lady ursula a jilt ; if [I]0-i said [I]0-i was not , [I]0-i must go on and tell [him]110-grandon that [the family]494-the family would be ruined and disgraced , or that [she]124-lady ursula must marry [Chundango]140-chundango to save it . [He]110-grandon would obtain comfort neither way . [He]110-grandon had evidently not seen [the Broadhems]176-the broadhems , and was therefore sure now to be in blissful ignorance that anything has happened at all . Better leave [him]110-grandon so . If [he]110-grandon is convinced that [Ursula]124-lady ursula loves [him]110-grandon , [he]110-grandon would never dream of [her]124-lady ursula accepting [me]0-i . Even had [our]707-our acquaintance been longer than it was , before [I]0-i was so mad as to think of proposing to [her]124-lady ursula , the best thing [I]0-i can do is certainly to hold [my]0-i tongue ; but then , [I]0-i thought , how will [he]110-grandon account for [my]0-i reserve ? what can [he]110-grandon think except that it arises from an unworthy motive?—and [I]0-i brushed [my]0-i hair viciously . At that instant [I]0-i heard a thump at the door , and before [I]0-i could answer , in walked the subject of [my]0-i meditation . " Well , [[my]110-grandon dear old fellow]2097-my dear old fellow , "[110-grandon] said [Grandon]110-grandon , as [he]110-grandon grasped [my]0-i hand warmly , " how mysterious and spasmodic [you]0-i have been in [your]0-i movements ! [I]110-grandon was afraid even now , if [I]110-grandon had not invaded the sanctity of [[your]0-i dressing - room]2385-your dressing - room , that [you]0-i would have slipped through [my]110-grandon fingers . [I]110-grandon know [you]0-i have a great deal to tell [me]110-grandon , of interest to [us]2386-us both , and [we]2386-us are [too fast friends]2387-too fast friends to hesitate to confide in [each other]320-each other on any matters which affect [our]2386-us happiness . [True men]2389-true men never have any reticence as between [themselves]2389-true men ; [they]2389-true men only have recourse to that armour when [they]2389-true men happen to be cursed with [false friends]2390-false friends . "[110-grandon] [I]0-i can not describe [my]0-i feelings during this speech . How on earth was [I]0-i to avoid reticence ? how show [him]708-him that [I]0-i loved and trusted [him]708-him when [I]0-i had just been elaborately devising a speech which should tell [him]708-him nothing ? and [I]0-i thought of [our]709-our school and then [our]709-our college days — how [I]0-i never seemed to be like [other boys]710-other boys or [other men of [my]0-i own age]711-other men of my own age — and how when [nobody]579-nobody understood [me]0-i [Grandon]110-grandon did , and how when [nobody]579-nobody defended [my]0-i peculiarities [Grandon]110-grandon did — how [he]110-grandon protected and advised [me]0-i at first out of sheer compassion , until at last [I]0-i had become as [a younger brother to [him]110-grandon]714-a younger brother to him . How distressed [he]110-grandon was when [I]0-i gave up diplomacy , and how anxious during the five years that [I]0-i was exploring in [the Far West]52-the far west and [gold - digging in [Australia]37-australia]715-gold - digging in australia ! and how nothing but [his]110-grandon letters ever induced [me]0-i to leave the wild reckless life that possessed such a wonderful charm for [me]0-i ; and how [he]110-grandon bore with [my]0-i wilfulness and vanity — for the faults of [my]0-i character at such moments would become painfully apparent to [me]0-i ; and how now [I]0-i was going to return it all , by allowing [him]110-grandon to suppose that [I]0-i had deliberately plotted against [his]110-grandon happiness , and ruthlessly sapped the solid foundations upon which [our]716-we life 's friendship had been built . [He]110-grandon saw these painful thoughts reflected but too accurately upon [my]0-i face , for [he]110-grandon had been accustomed to read it for so many years , and [he]110-grandon smiled a look of encouragement and kindliness . " Come , "[110-grandon] [he]110-grandon said , " [I]110-grandon will tell [you]0-i exactly , first , everything [I]110-grandon suspect , and then everything [I]110-grandon know , and then what [I]110-grandon think about it , so that [you]0-i will have as little of the labour of revelation as possible . "[110-grandon] " A letter from [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem ? "[0-i] said [I]0-i , aghast . " Yes , "[717-me] [he]717-me said , " in which [she]166-lady broadhem encloses a copy of one of [yours]0-i containing a proposal to [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula , and informs [me]717-me that [you]0-i were aware , when [you]0-i made it , of the difficulties [you]0-i might have to encounter through [me]717-me . [She]166-lady broadhem goes on to say that , whatever may have been [[her]166-lady broadhem daughter]566-her daughter 's feelings towards [me]717-me at one time , they have completely changed , as [she]166-lady broadhem at once accepted [you]0-i ; and [she]166-lady broadhem winds up with the rather unnecessary remark that this is the less to be regretted by [me]717-me , as under no circumstances would [I]717-me have obtained either [her]166-lady broadhem consent or that of [Lord Broadhem]122-lord broadhem . And so , "[717-me] [[my]0-i poor friend]718-my poor friend went on , but [his]718-my poor friend lips were quivering , and [I]0-i turned away [my]0-i eyes to avoid seeing the effort it cost him—"and so , [you]0-i see , [[my]719-me dear]1860-my dear [Frank]164-frank , it is all for the best . In the first place , [she]166-lady broadhem never loved [me]719-me . [I]719-me have too high an opinion of [her]166-lady broadhem to suppose that if [she]166-lady broadhem had , [she]166-lady broadhem would have accepted [you]0-i ; in the second , [she]166-lady broadhem would never have married [me]719-me against [[her]166-lady broadhem mother]365-her mother 's consent — and so , even if [she]166-lady broadhem had loved [me]719-me , [we]2394-we should have both been miserable ; and thirdly , if there is one thing that could console [me]719-me under such a blow , it is , that [the man [she]166-lady broadhem loves]2395-the man she loves , and [the family]494-the family approve , is [[my]719-me dear old friend]2397-my dear old friend , who is far more worthy the happiness in store for [him]719-me than [I]719-me should have been . "[719-me] [He]719-me put [his]719-me hand kindly on [my]0-i shoulder as [his]719-me strong voice shook with the force of [his]719-me suppressed emotion , and [I]0-i bowed [my]0-i head . [I]0-i felt utterly humiliated by a magnanimity so noble , and by a tenderness surpassing that of [women]720-women . [I]0-i thanked [God]130-god at that moment that [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula did not love [me]0-i , and [I]0-i vowed that [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem should bitterly expiate [her]166-lady broadhem sins against [[us]721-us both]722-us both . Here , then , was the secret of [her]166-lady broadhem refusing to acknowledge that [she]166-lady broadhem had stolen [my]0-i missing letter at [Dickiefield]120-dickiefield , and this was the precious use [she]166-lady broadhem had made of it . The question now was , What was to be done ? But [my]0-i mind was paralysed — all its strength seemed expended in vowing vengeance against [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem . When [I]0-i tried to form a sentence of explanation to [Grandon]110-grandon , [my]0-i brain refused its functions ; [I]0-i felt as if [I]0-i were in a net , and that the slightest movement on [my]0-i part would entangle [me]0-i more inextricably in its meshes . The last resolution [I]0-i had come to before [he]110-grandon entered [the room]2119-the room was on no account to tell [him]110-grandon anything , and this resolution had now become an idée fixe . [I]0-i had not clearness of mind at the moment to decide whether it was right or wrong . [I]0-i felt that when [my]0-i head was clear [I]0-i had come to the conclusion that it was best , so [I]0-i stuck to it now . True , it involved leaving [him]110-grandon in the delusion that [Ursula]124-lady ursula and [I]0-i were engaged — but was it altogether certain to remain a delusion ? Did [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula really care for [him]110-grandon ? [I]0-i had only [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's word for it . Again , had [I]0-i anything better to give [him]110-grandon ? would it be a comfort to [him]110-grandon to hear the Chundango alternative ? These in a confused way were the thoughts which flitted across [my]0-i brain in this moment of doubt and difficulty , so [I]0-i said nothing . [He]110-grandon misinterpreted [my]0-i silence , and thought [me]0-i overwhelmed with remorse at the part [I]0-i had played . " Believe [me]110-grandon , "[110-grandon] [he]110-grandon said , " [I]110-grandon do not think one particle the worse of [you]0-i for what [you]0-i have done ; [I]110-grandon know how difficult it is to control one 's feelings in moments of passion ; and [you]0-i see [you]0-i were quite right not to believe [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem when [she]166-lady broadhem told [you]0-i [Ursula]124-lady ursula cared for [me]110-grandon . "[110-grandon] " [I]0-i had already written the letter , "[0-i] [I]0-i stammered out . " Of course [you]110-grandon had : [I]0-i never supposed [you]110-grandon could do the dishonourable thing of hearing [she]124-lady ursula cared about [me]0-i first , and writing to [her]124-lady ursula afterwards , although [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem said so . "[0-i] This was a well - meant but such a very unsuccessful attempt at resignation on [Grandon]110-grandon 's part , that it touched [me]0-i to the quick . " [[My]0-i dear]1860-my dear [Grandon]110-grandon , "[0-i] [I]0-i said — and [I]0-i saw [my]0-i face in the glass opposite , looking white and stony with the effort it cost [me]0-i not to fall upon [his]110-grandon neck and cry like a woman—"I solemnly swear , whatever [you]110-grandon may think now , that the day will come when [you]110-grandon will find that [I]110-grandon was worthy the privilege of having been even [[your]110-grandon friend]2161-your friend . [I]110-grandon was going to say , Till then , believe [me]110-grandon and trust [me]110-grandon ; but [I]110-grandon need not , for [I]110-grandon know that , however unnatural it seems for [me]110-grandon to ask [you]110-grandon not to allude again to the subject [we]2401-we have just been discussing , [you]110-grandon will be satisfied that [I]110-grandon would not ask it without having a reason which if [you]110-grandon knew [you]110-grandon would approve . "[110-grandon] [Grandon]110-grandon 's face lit up with a bright frank smile . " [I]110-grandon trust and believe in [you]110-grandon from the bottom of [my]110-grandon soul , and [you]110-grandon shall bury any subject [you]110-grandon like till it suits [you]110-grandon to exhume it . "[110-grandon] " Well , "[0-i] thought [I]0-i , as [I]0-i followed [Grandon]110-grandon down - stairs , " for [a man who is yearning to be honest , and to do the right thing by everybody]2403-a man who is yearning to be honest , and to do the right thing by everybody , [I]0-i have got into as elaborate a complication of lies as if [I]0-i were [a Russian diplomatist]2404-a russian diplomatist . First , [I]0-i have given both [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem and [Grandon]110-grandon distinctly to understand that [I]0-i am at this moment engaged to [Ursula]124-lady ursula , which [I]0-i am not ; and secondly , [I]0-i have solemnly assured that [young lady]2405-young lady [herself]2405-young lady that [I]0-i am conscious of being occasionally mad . "[0-i] In this tissue of falsehoods , it is poor consolation to think that the only one in which there may be some foundation of truth is the last . Supposing [I]0-i was to go in for dishonesty , perhaps [I]0-i could not help telling the truth by the rule of " contraries . "[0-i] [I]0-i will go and ask [the Honourable Spiffington]175-the honourable spiffington goldtip whether [he]175-the honourable spiffington goldtip finds this to be the case , and [I]0-i parted from [Grandon]110-grandon in the hope of catching [that gentleman]724-that gentleman before [he]110-grandon had betaken [himself]110-grandon to [[his]110-grandon civic haunts]725-his civic haunts . [I]0-i was too late , and pursued [him]110-grandon east of [Temple Bar]54-temple bar . Here [he]110-grandon frequented sundry " board - rooms "[0-i] of companies which by a figure of speech [he]110-grandon helped to " direct , "[0-i] and was also to be found in [the neighbourhood of [Hercules Passage]55-hercules passage]726-the neighbourhood of hercules passage and [the narrow streets which surround [the Stock Exchange]728-the stock exchange]727-the narrow streets which surround the stock exchange , in [the little back dens of [pet brokers upon whom [he]110-grandon relied for " good things]2406-pet brokers upon whom he relied for " good things . "[0-i] [Spiffy]159-spiffy]729-the little back dens of pet brokers upon whom he relied for " good things . " spiffy used to collect political news in fashionable circles all through the night and up to an early hour of the morning , and then come into [the City]1952-the city with it red - hot , so as to " operate . "[159-spiffy] [He]159-spiffy was [one of the most lively little rabbits to be found in [all that big warren of which [the Bank]56-the bank]732-all that big warren of which the bank is the centre]731-one of the most lively little rabbits to be found in all that big warren of which the bank is the centre , and popped in and out of the different holes with a quickness that made [him]159-spiffy very difficult to catch . At last [I]0-i ran [him]110-grandon to [a very dingy earth]733-a very dingy earth , where [he]110-grandon was pausing , seated on a green baize table over a glass of sherry and a biscuit , and chaffing [a rising young broker who hoped ultimately to be proposed]734-a rising young broker who hoped ultimately to be proposed by [Spiffy]159-spiffy for [the Piccadilly Club]735-the piccadilly club . [He]110-grandon was trying to establish a claim thereto now , on the strength of having been at [Mrs Gorgon Tompkins]170-mrs gorgon tompkins 's ball on the previous evening . " It is rather against [you]0-i than otherwise , "[159-spiffy] said [Spiffy]159-spiffy , who was [an extremely off - hand little fellow]736-an extremely off - hand little fellow , and did not interrupt [his]159-spiffy discourse after [he]159-spiffy had nodded to [me]0-i familiarly ; " [I]159-spiffy ca n't afford to take [you]0-i up yet ; indeed , what have [you]0-i ever done to merit it ? and [Mrs Gorgon Tompkins]170-mrs gorgon tompkins has enough to do this season to keep [her]170-mrs gorgon tompkins own head above water without attempting to float [you]0-i . [I]159-spiffy did what [I]159-spiffy could for [her]170-mrs gorgon tompkins last night , but [she]170-mrs gorgon tompkins ca n't expect to go on with [her]170-mrs gorgon tompkins successes of last year . [We]2407-we had a regular scene at 6 A.M. this morning , ' in [banquet halls deserted'—tears]2408-banquet halls deserted'—tears , and all that sort of thing — [nobody]579-nobody present but [self]1966-self , [Gorgon]170-mrs gorgon tompkins , and [partner]2411-partner . How [Ursula]124-lady ursula manages on these occasions [I]0-i can not conceive , but [I]0-i do [my]0-i best to prevent [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem talking about [me]0-i to [her]166-lady broadhem , as [I]0-i always say mysteriously , that if [she]166-lady broadhem does , " it will spoil everything"—an[0-i] alarming phrase , which produces an immediate effect . Still it is quite clear that this kind of thing ca n't continue long . If [I]0-i can only keep matters going for a few days more , [they]777-their will all be out of [town]2093-town for Easter , and that will give [me]0-i time to breathe . This , however , by no means prevents [their]777-their using [their]777-their utmost endeavours to ruin [me]0-i . That is the present state of matters . The situation can not remain unchanged during the next four weeks . Have [I]0-i [your]783-your sympathies , [dear reader]784-dear reader ? Do [you]783-your wish [me]0-i well out of it ? [Piccadilly]7-piccadilly , May. The great difficulty which [I]0-i find in this record of [my]0-i eventful existence is , that [I]0-i have too much to say . The sensations of [my]0-i life will not distribute themselves properly . It is quite impossible for [me]0-i to cram all that [I]0-i think , say , and do every month into the limited space at [my]0-i disposal . Thus [I]0-i am positively overwhelmed with the brilliant dialogues , the elevating reflections , and the thrilling incidents , all of which [I]0-i desire to relate . [No one who has not tried this sort of thing]785-no one who has not tried this sort of thing can imagine the chronological , to say nothing of the crinological , difficulties in which [I]0-i find [myself]0-i . For instance , the incidents which occupied the whole of [my]0-i last chapter took place in twenty - four hours , and yet how could [I]0-i have left out either the poison - scene , or [my]0-i interview with [Grandon]110-grandon , or [Spiffy]159-spiffy 's interesting social projects ? Much better have left out the poison - scene , say some of [[my]0-i critical friends]786-my critical friends . It was not natural — too grotesque ; but is that [my]0-i fault ? If nature has jammed [me]0-i into a most unnatural and uncomfortable niche in that single step which is said to lead from the sublime to the ridiculous , am [I]0-i responsible for it ? If , instead of taking merely a serio - comic view of life , like [some of [[my]0-i acquaintances]788-my acquaintances]787-some of my acquaintances , [I]0-i regard it from a tragic - burlesque aspect , how can [I]0-i help it ? [I]0-i did not put [my]0-i ideas into [my]0-i own head , nor invent the extraordinary things that happen to [me,—and]789-me,—and this is the reflection which renders [me]0-i so profoundly indifferent to criticism . [I]0-i shall have reviewers finding out that [I]0-i am inconsistent with [myself]0-i , and not true to nature here — as , for instance , when [I]0-i fell violently in love with [Ursula]124-lady ursula in one evening ; or to the first principles of art there — as when [I]0-i wrote to propose to [her]124-lady ursula next morning : as if both art and nature could not take care of [themselves]790-themselves without [my]0-i bothering [my]0-i head about them . Once for all , then , [my]0-i difficulties do not arise from this source at all ; they are , as [I]0-i have said before , of the most simple character . In fact , they resolve [themselves]790-themselves into [Kant]182-kant 's two great a priori ideas , time and space . Now [I]0-i could quite easily run on in the moral reflective vein to the end of the chapter , but then what should [I]0-i do with the conversations which [I]0-i ought to record , but to which [I]0-i shall not be able to do justice , because [I]0-i am so bound and fettered by the chain of [my]0-i narrative ? What an idea of weakness it conveys of [an author who talks of " the thread of [his]2456-an author who talks of " the thread of his narrative narrative]2456-an author who talks of " the thread of his narrative ! "[2456-an author who talks of " the thread of his narrative] [I]0-i even used to feel it when [I]0-i was in the diplomatic service , and received a severe " wigging "[791-the foreign office] once for writing in one of [my]0-i despatches , " [[My]791-the foreign office lord]2022-my lord , [I]791-the foreign office have the honour to resume the ' tape ' of [my]791-the foreign office narrative"—so[791-the foreign office] wedded is [the Foreign Office]791-the foreign office to the traditions of [its]791-the foreign office own peculiar style . [I]0-i was glad afterwards [they]791-the foreign office kept [me]0-i to " the thread , "[791-the foreign office] as when [I]0-i wanted finally to break it [I]0-i found no difficulty . By the way , after [I]0-i have done with [society]297-society , [I]0-i am going to take up the departments of [the public service]793-the public service . If [I]0-i let [them]791-the foreign office alone just now , it is only because [I]0-i am so desperately in love , and [my]0-i love is so desperately hopeless ; and the whole thing is in such a mess , that one mess is enough . At present [I]0-i am setting [[my]0-i dwelling - house]794-my dwelling - house in order . When that is done [I]0-i will go to work to clean out [the " offices]2458-the " offices . "[0-i]

[I]0-i may also allude here to another somewhat embarrassing circumstance which , had [I]0-i not the good of [[my]0-i fellow - creatures]795-my fellow - creatures at heart , might interfere with the progress of [my]0-i narrative ; and this is the morbid satisfaction which it seems to afford [some people]2168-some people to claim for [themselves]2168-some people the credit of being the most disagreeable or unworthy of [those individuals with whom [I]0-i am at present in contact]797-those individuals with whom i am at present in contact . [They]2168-some people would pretend , for instance , that there is [no such person in society]798-no such person in society as [Spiffington Goldtip]175-the honourable spiffington goldtip , but that [I]0-i mean [him]175-the honourable spiffington goldtip to represent [some one else]799-some one else ; and [they]2168-some people take the ' Court Guide , ' and find that [no Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem lives in [Grosvenor Square]42-grosvenor square , so [they]2168-some people suppose that [she]166-lady broadhem too stands for [some one else who does]800-some one else who does . Now , if [I]0-i hear much of this sort of thing [I]0-i shall stop altogether . In the first place , neither [Spiffy]159-spiffy nor [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem will like it ; and in the second , it is very disagreeable to [me]0-i to be supposed to caricature [[my]0-i acquaintances]788-my acquaintances under false names . The cap is made a great deal too large to fit [any particular individual]802-any particular individual , so there is no use in trying it on ; but when , perchance , [I]0-i find [groups of people]803-groups of people acting unworthily , [I]0-i should be falling into the same error for which [I]0-i blame [the parsonic body of the present day]804-the parsonic body of the present day , if [I]0-i shrank from exposing and cutting straight into the sores that [they]2168-some people are fain to plaster and conceal . In these days of amateur preaching in [theatres]805-theatres and [other unconsecrated buildings]806-other unconsecrated buildings , [I]0-i feel [I]0-i owe no apology to [[my]0-i clerical brethren]807-my clerical brethren for taking [[their]807-my clerical brethren congregations]808-their congregations in hand after [they]807-my clerical brethren have quite done with [them]808-their congregations . [People]293-people may call [me]0-i [a " physician "]2459-a " physician "[2459-a " physician "] or any other name [they]293-people like , and tell [me]0-i to heal [myself]0-i ; but it is quite clear that [a sick physician who needs rest]810-a sick physician who needs rest , and yet devotes all [his]810-a sick physician who needs rest time and energies to the curing of [[his]810-a sick physician who needs rest neighbours]1933-his neighbours , is [a far more unselfish individual than one who waits to do it till [he]810-a sick physician who needs rest is robust]812-a far more unselfish individual than one who waits to do it till he is robust . Therefore , if [I]0-i am caught doing [myself]0-i the very things [I]0-i find fault with in [others]307-others , " that has nothing at all to do with it , "[166-lady broadhem] as [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem always says when all [her]166-lady broadhem arguments are exhausted . [Those of [[my]0-i readers]308-my readers who have taken an interest in [[her]166-lady broadhem ladyship]2136-her ladyship 's speculations and in [my]0-i endeavours to extricate [her]166-lady broadhem from [her]166-lady broadhem pecuniary embarrassments]814-those of my readers who have taken an interest in her ladyship 's speculations and in my endeavours to extricate her from her pecuniary embarrassments , may conceive [our]817-our feelings upon hearing of the surrender of [General Lee]183-general lee . [I]0-i regret to say that , in spite of every device which the experience of [Spiffy]159-spiffy , of [[Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's lawyer]769-lady broadhem 's lawyer , and of [Lady B.]184-lady b. [herself]166-lady broadhem could suggest , [her]166-lady broadhem liabilities have increased to such an extent in consequence of the rapid fall of [Confederate stock]819-confederate stock , that [I]0-i was obliged to take advantage of the Easter recess to run over to [Ireland]14-ireland to make arrangements for selling an extremely encumbered estate which [I]0-i purchased as a speculation some years ago , but have never before visited . This trip has given [me]0-i an opportunity of enabling [me]0-i thoroughly to master the Irish question . [I]0-i need scarcely say how much [I]0-i was surprised at the prosperous condition of [the peasants of [Connemara]57-connemara]820-the peasants of connemara after the accounts [I]0-i had received of [them]820-the peasants of connemara . When [I]0-i " surveyed "[820-the peasants of connemara] [[my]0-i own estate]821-my own estate , which consists of [seven miles of uninterrupted rock]822-seven miles of uninterrupted rock , [I]0-i regarded with admiration [the population who could find the means of subsistence upon it , and whose rags were frequently of a very superior quality]823-the population who could find the means of subsistence upon it , and whose rags were frequently of a very superior quality . [I]0-i also felt how creditable it was to [the British Government]80-the government , that by a judicious system of legislation it should succeed in keeping [people]293-people comparatively happy and contented , whose principal occupation seemed to [me]0-i to consist in wading about [the sea - beach]825-the sea - beach looking for [sea - weed]826-sea - weed , and whose diet was composed of what [they]293-people found there . That [every Irishman [I]0-i met]827-every irishman i met should expect [me]0-i to lament with [him]827-every irishman i met the decrease by emigration in the population of [a nation which subsists chiefly on [peat and periwinkles]829-peat and periwinkles , illustrated in a striking manner]828-a nation which subsists chiefly on peat and periwinkles , illustrated in a striking manner the indifference which [the individuals of this singular race]830-the individuals of this singular race have for each other 's sufferings ; and it is quite a mistake , therefore , to suppose that [absentee landlords , who are for the most part Irish]831-absentee landlords , who are for the most part irish , live away from [[their]831-absentee landlords , who are for the most part irish properties]832-their properties because [they]831-absentee landlords , who are for the most part irish are so susceptible to the sight of distress that [they]831-absentee landlords , who are for the most part irish can not bear to look upon [[their]831-absentee landlords , who are for the most part irish own tenantry]833-their own tenantry . To [an Englishman]834-an englishman nothing is more consoling than to feel that the Irish question is essentially an Irish question , and that [Englishmen]835-englishmen have nothing at all to do with it — that the tenant - right question is one between [Irish landlords]836-irish landlords and [Irish tenants]837-irish tenants — that the religious question is one between [Irish Catholics]838-irish catholics and [Irish Protestants]839-irish protestants — and that the reason that [no Englishman]840-no englishman can understand [them]841-them is , because [they]841-them are Irish , and inverted brains would be necessary to [their]841-them comprehension . These considerations impressed [themselves]841-them forcibly upon [my]0-i notice at a meeting of [the National League]842-the national league , which [I]0-i attended in [Dublin]59-dublin , the object of which was to secure the national independence of [Ireland]14-ireland , and to free [it]14-ireland from the tyranny of British rule . [One of [the speakers]844-the speakers]843-one of the speakers made out so strong a case for [England]10-england , that [I]0-i could only account for it by the fact that [he]843-one of the speakers was [an Irishman]845-an irishman arguing the case of [[his]843-one of the speakers [own country]1957-own country]1956-his own country . " How , "[843-one of the speakers] [he]843-one of the speakers asked , " is [the English Parliament]60-the english parliament to know [our]2460-we grievances , when out of [105 members that [we]2460-we send up to it]2461-105 members that we send up to it , there are [not two who are honest]2462-not two who are honest ? Why is not [the O'Donoghue]185-the o'donoghue in the chair to - day ? [he]185-the o'donoghue is [the only real patriot]2463-the only real patriot , and [we]2460-we ca n't trust [him]185-the o'donoghue . Why are [the Irish Protestants]2464-the irish protestants not true to [themselves]2464-the irish protestants and the cause ? Is it because [we]2460-we have got [them]186-irishmen already ? No ; but because [Irishmen]186-irishmen do not care a farthing about [them]186-irishmen . Shame on [them]186-irishmen for [their]186-irishmen apathy , "[843-one of the speakers] & c. It was pleasant to listen to [this Irish patriot]848-this irish patriot inveighing against [[his]848-this irish patriot countrymen]849-his countrymen , and finally making [England]10-england responsible for [Irishmen]186-irishmen being what [they]186-irishmen are . Bless [them]186-irishmen ! [my]0-i heart warmed towards [them]186-irishmen as [I]0-i saw [them]186-irishmen at [Queenstown]62-queenstown trooping on board [an emigrant - ship]850-an emigrant - ship , looking ruddy and prosperous , bound on the useful errand of propagating Fenianism , of exhibiting [themselves]186-irishmen as choice specimens of [an oppressed nationality]851-an oppressed nationality , and of devoting [their]186-irishmen brilliant political instincts , [their]186-irishmen indefatigable industry , and [their]186-irishmen judicial calmness , to the service of [that country]852-that country which is at present in danger of suffering from a determination of blood to the head in the person of [Andy Johnson]187-andy johnson . If anything can trim that somewhat crank craft " [United States]63-united states , "[186-irishmen] let [us]853-us hope that it will be by taking in [Irishmen]186-irishmen at the rate of one thousand per week to serve as ballast ; for most certainly the best means of increasing the sailing qualities of the leaky old tub , " British Constitution , "[186-irishmen] will be by inducing the ballast aforesaid to throw itself overboard . [I]0-i was pitching and rolling abominably between [Kingston]64-kingston and [Holyhead]65-holyhead as [I]0-i drew this appropriate nautical parallel , and was not in a mood to relish the following announcement , which appeared in the pages of a fashionable organ , that happened to be the first journal [I]0-i bought in [England]10-england : — " [We]853-us are in a position to state that a marriage is arranged between [Lord Frank Vanecourt]116-lord frank , M.P. , [second son of [the late Duke of [Dunderhead]35-dunderhead]2469-the late duke of dunderhead , and [Lady Ursula Newlyte]124-lady ursula , [eldest daughter of [the late Earl of Broadhem]135-the earl of broadhem]2470-eldest daughter of the late earl of broadhem]2468-second son of the late duke of dunderhead , and lady ursula newlyte , eldest daughter of the late earl of broadhem . "[0-i] How [I]0-i envied " [our]853-us position , "[0-i] and what a very different one [mine]0-i was ! However , the notice served its purpose , for it prepared [me]0-i for what [I]0-i should have to encounter in [London]5-london — the sort of running fire of congratulation [I]0-i must expect to undergo all along [Piccadilly]7-piccadilly , down [St James 's Street]45-st james 's street , and along [Pall Mall]66-pall mall . Should [I]0-i simper a coy admission , or storm out an indignant denial ? On the whole , the most judicious line seemed to be to do each alternately . The prospect of puzzling [the gossip - mongers]854-the gossip - mongers generally almost consoled [me]0-i for the feeling of extreme annoyance which [I]0-i had experienced . " The imbroglio must clear itself at last , "[0-i] thought [I]0-i , " but it will be a curious amusement to see how long [I]0-i can keep it from doing so ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i bought an evening paper as [I]0-i approached [London]5-london , by way of distracting [my]0-i mind . The first news which thrilled [me]0-i as [I]0-i opened it was the announcement of the assassination of [President Lincoln]188-president lincoln . [I]0-i am not going to moralise on this event now , and only allude to it as it affects the story of [my]0-i own life . It saved [me]0-i that evening from the embarrassment [I]0-i had anticipated ; for even when [I]0-i went to [the Cosmopolitan]67-the cosmopolitan , [I]0-i found [everybody]318-everybody listening to [Mr Wog]131-mr wog , so that [nobody]579-nobody cared about [my]0-i private affairs , and it induced [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem to make a secret expedition into [the City of a speculative nature]857-the city of a speculative nature next morning , as [I]0-i accidentally discovered from [Spiffy]159-spiffy . It is not impossible that the knowledge of this breach of faith on [her]166-lady broadhem part may prove a valuable piece of information to [me]0-i . [I]0-i sauntered into " [the Piccadilly]7-piccadilly "[166-lady broadhem] on the following afternoon , armed at all points , and approached the bay - window , in which [I]0-i observed [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem and [several others seated round the table]858-several others seated round the table , with the utmost insouciance . [They]859-they had evidently just talked [my]0-i matter over , for [my]0-i appearance caused a momentary pause , and then a general chorus of greeting . [I]0-i am not such a fool as not to know exactly what all [[my]0-i friends]305-my friends said of the match behind [my]0-i back : " [Sharp old woman]2474-sharp old woman , [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem ; [she]166-lady broadhem 'll make that flat , [Frank Vanecourt]116-lord frank , pay all the Broadhem debts ; "[305-my friends] or , " Odd thing it is that [such a nice girl]2475-such a nice girl as [Ursula Newlyte]124-lady ursula should throw [herself]2475-such a nice girl away on [such a maniac]2476-such a maniac as [Frank Vanecourt]116-lord frank ; "[305-my friends] then , " Oh , [she]2475-such a nice girl 'd marry [anybody]2240-anybody to get away from [such a mother]2478-such a mother ; "[305-my friends] again , " [I]305-my friends always thought [Vanecourt]116-lord frank [a fool]2299-a fool , but [I]305-my friends never supposed [he]116-lord frank would have deliberately submitted to be bled by [the Broadhems]176-the broadhems . Now [I]0-i am striking out quite a new line to meet the humbug , the hypocrisy , the scandal , and the ill - nature of which both [Ursula]124-lady ursula and [myself]0-i are [the subjects]866-the subjects . " [[My]0-i dear]1860-my dear [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " for reasons which it is not necessary for [me]0-i now to enter into , but which are connected with the pecuniary arrangements [I]0-i am making to put [your]1860-my dear family matters straight , this announcement is a most unfortunate occurrence — [we]2481-we must take measures to contradict it immediately . "[0-i] " Why , "[166-lady broadhem] said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , " if it is the case , as [you]0-i know it is , [I]166-lady broadhem do n't see the harm of announcing it . "[166-lady broadhem] " Ah , then , [I]0-i fancy the announcement was made on [your]166-lady broadhem authority , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " It is a pity , as [I]0-i had made up [my]0-i mind to postpone the ceremony until [I]0-i had not only completed all [my]0-i arrangements for putting [your]1860-my dear family matters square , but could actually see [my]0-i way towards gradually clearing off the more pressing liabilities with which the estate is encumbered . [You]0-i know what [a crotchety fellow]2482-a crotchety fellow [I]0-i am . "[0-i] [I]0-i felt a malicious pleasure in watching [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's face during this speech , as [I]0-i was sure that [he]870-his had done [his]870-his best to spread the report of [my]0-i marriage with [[his]870-his sister]759-his sister for fear of [my]0-i backing out , and escaping from [my]0-i obligations in respect to [his]870-his financial embarrassments . " It will be pleasanter for [us]2485-us both , "[0-i] [I]0-i went on , " that [the world]271-the world should never be able to say , after [my]0-i marriage with [[your]166-lady broadhem sister]2483-your sister , that [you]166-lady broadhem and [[your]166-lady broadhem mother]419-your mother continue to live upon [us]2485-us . Now , [I]0-i tell [you]166-lady broadhem fairly , that , for family reasons , this premature announcement renders it impossible for [me]0-i to proceed with those arrangements which must precede [my]0-i connection with [[your]166-lady broadhem family]428-your family . "[0-i] [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's face grew very long while [he]870-his listened to this speech . " But , "[870-his] [he]870-his said , " it is not fair to [Ursula]124-lady ursula that [everybody]318-everybody should suppose that [you]166-lady broadhem are engaged to [her]124-lady ursula , and refuse to acknowledge it . "[870-his] " Pray , whose fault is it , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " that [anybody]2240-anybody supposes anything about it ? [I]0-i have never told [a soul]2492-a soul that [I]0-i was engaged to be married , and if [you]166-lady broadhem and [[your]166-lady broadhem mother]419-your mother choose to go spreading unauthorised reports , [you]166-lady broadhem must take the consequences ; but"—and[0-i] a sudden inspiration flashed upon me—"I will tell [you]166-lady broadhem what [I]870-his will do , [I]870-his will be guided entirely by [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula 's wishes in the matter . "[870-his] " Very well , "[166-lady broadhem] said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , " that sounds fair enough . [I]166-lady broadhem 'll go and see [Ursula]124-lady ursula at once . "[166-lady broadhem] " Not quite so fast ; please take [me]0-i with [you]166-lady broadhem , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " As it is a matter most closely affecting [my]0-i future happiness , [I]0-i must be present at the interview , and so must [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem . "[0-i] " [I]166-lady broadhem do n't think that is an arrangement which will suit [Ursula]124-lady ursula at all . In fact , both [she]124-lady ursula and [[my]166-lady broadhem mother]417-my mother are so incomprehensible and mysterious , that [I]166-lady broadhem am sure [they]2496-they will object to any such meeting . Whenever [I]166-lady broadhem have spoken to [[my]166-lady broadhem mother]417-my mother about it , [she]417-my mother always meets [me]166-lady broadhem with , ' For goodness ' sake , do n't breathe a word to [Ursula]124-lady ursula , or [you]124-lady ursula will spoil all ; ' and when , in defiance of this injunction , [I]166-lady broadhem did speak to [Ursula]124-lady ursula , [she]124-lady ursula said , in a lackadaisical way , that [she]124-lady ursula had no intention of marrying [any one at present]2498-any one at present ; and when [I]166-lady broadhem went on to say that in that case [she]124-lady ursula had no business to accept [you]124-lady ursula , [she]124-lady ursula asked [me]166-lady broadhem what reason [I]166-lady broadhem had for supposing that [she]124-lady ursula ever had done so ; and when [I]166-lady broadhem said , ' the assurance of [[my]166-lady broadhem mother]417-my mother 's ears in [the drawing - room at [Dickiefield]120-dickiefield]2500-the drawing - room at dickiefield , ' [she]124-lady ursula stared at [me]166-lady broadhem with amazement , and burst into a flood of tears . "[166-lady broadhem] " Under these circumstances , do n't [you]124-lady ursula think [you]124-lady ursula would have done better not to meddle in the matter at all ? "[0-i] [I]0-i remarked . " However , the mischief is done now , and perhaps the best plan will be for [you]124-lady ursula to bring about a meeting between [[your]124-lady ursula sister]2483-your sister and [myself]0-i . [I]0-i suppose whatever [we]2502-we arrange will satisfy [you]124-lady ursula and [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem ? "[0-i] " Well , [I]166-lady broadhem do n't know , "[166-lady broadhem] said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , doubtfully ; " [she]124-lady ursula does not seem to know [her]124-lady ursula own mind , and [I]166-lady broadhem do n't feel very sure of [you]124-lady ursula . However , [you]124-lady ursula are master of the situation , and can arrange what [you]124-lady ursula like . [[My]166-lady broadhem mother]417-my mother is going to a May meeting at [Exeter Hall]20-exeter hall to - morrow to hear [Caribbee Islands]136-joseph and [Chundango]126-chundango hold forth . "[166-lady broadhem] This conversation took place as [we]872-we were strolling arm - in - arm down [St James 's Street]45-st james 's street on [our]872-we way to [the House]2095-the house , thereby enabling [the groups of [[our]872-we friends who inspected [us]872-we from [divers club]876-divers club - windows]875-our friends who inspected us from divers club - windows]874-the groups of our friends who inspected us from divers club - windows to assert confidently the truth of the report . " [I]110-grandon suppose , now that [your]0-i marriage is publicly announced , [Frank]116-lord frank , it need no longer be a tabooed subject between [us]872-we , and that [you]0-i will receive [my]110-grandon congratulations . "[193-scraper] " Then [you]0-i got a most deliberate and atrocious fabrication , for [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i mean the report of [my]0-i marriage to [[his]122-lord broadhem sister]759-his sister , and [I]0-i beg [you]0-i will contradict it most emphatically whenever [you]0-i hear it , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , very stiffly . [I]0-i looked in vain for [Grandon]110-grandon ; [his]110-grandon accustomed seat remained empty , and [I]0-i felt deeply penitent and miserable . What is there in [my]0-i nature that prompts [me]0-i , when [I]0-i am trying to act honestly and nobly , to be impracticable and perverse ? [Grandon]110-grandon could not know the extent of the complication in which [I]0-i am involved , and was right in saying what [he]110-grandon did ; yet [I]0-i could no more at the moment help resenting it as [I]0-i did , than [a man in a passion who is struck can help returning the blow]887-a man in a passion who is struck can help returning the blow . "[0-i] To have made it thoroughly unlucky [I]0-i ought to have been [there]1987-there as [a thirteenth]893-a thirteenth . All this was easy enough , but [my]0-i imagination failed to suggest what probably passed between [Grandon]110-grandon and [Ursula]124-lady ursula ; so [I]0-i screwed up [my]0-i courage and determined to go up to [[Grandon]110-grandon 's room]897-grandon 's room and find out [We]898-we often used to breakfast together , and [I]0-i sent up [[my]0-i servant]544-my servant to tell [him]544-my servant to expect [me]0-i . Under the circumstances [I]0-i thought it right to give [him]544-my servant the opportunity of refusing to see [me]0-i , but [I]0-i knew [him]544-my servant too well to think that [he]544-my servant would take advantage of it . [He]544-my servant was sitting at [his]544-my servant writing - table looking pale and haggard , as [I]0-i entered , and turned wearily towards [me]0-i with an air of reserve very foreign to [his]544-my servant nature . " [[My]0-i dear]1860-my dear [Grandon]110-grandon , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i have come to apologise to [you]110-grandon for [my]0-i unjustifiable conduct yesterday , but [you]110-grandon can not conceive the worry and annoyance to which [I]0-i have been subject by the impertinent curiosity and unwarrantable interference of [the world]271-the world in [my]0-i private affairs . "[0-i] " The mischief is done , "[110-grandon] said [Grandon]110-grandon , gloomily , " and it is not in [your]110-grandon power to undo it . "[0-i] " [You]110-grandon know perfectly well that as [you]110-grandon stand in no nearer relation to [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula than [I]110-grandon do , "[110-grandon] and [Grandon]110-grandon 's voice trembled , while [his]110-grandon eye gleamed for a second with a flash of triumph , " [you]110-grandon have no right to insist upon anything ; but [I]110-grandon have no objection to tell [you]110-grandon that as [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula was quite in ignorance of any such report having currency as that which has now received a certain stamp of authority , by virtue of the conspiracy into which [you]110-grandon seem to have entered with [[her]124-lady ursula mother]365-her mother and [brother]767-brother , [she]124-lady ursula was overwhelmed with confusion at the congratulations which it seems [the ladies]381-the ladies heaped upon [her]124-lady ursula after dinner last night , and finally fainted . "[900-i] [I]0-i had discovered what [I]0-i wanted , for in spite of every effort to conceal it , [I]0-i detected a mixture of jealousy and of triumph in [Grandon]110-grandon 's last speech . "[0-i] " [I]905-i have done that for some time , "[905-i] [he]905-i replied , " but [you]0-i know how perfectly hopeless [our]2530-our love is ; and yet , "[905-i] and [his]905-i voice deepened and [his]905-i face flushed with enthusiasm , " [I]905-i am happier loving hopelessly and knowing that [I]905-i am loved , than [I]905-i have ever been before . "[905-i] " [Grandon]110-grandon , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , sententiously , " [my]0-i conscience works on a system utterly incomprehensible to an ordinary intelligence , and [I]0-i am quite satisfied with it . "[0-i] " Do n't trifle , "[110-grandon] said [Grandon]110-grandon , sternly , interrupting [me]0-i ; " [my]110-grandon patience is not inexhaustible . [Apropos]199-apropos , [you]110-grandon have never asked [me]0-i what [I]0-i have been doing in that line ; nor told [me]0-i what [you]110-grandon thought of the long letter [I]0-i wrote [you]110-grandon from [Flityville]29-flityville . "[0-i] " No , "[110-grandon] [he]110-grandon replied , " [I]110-grandon must honestly tell [you]0-i , [Frank]116-lord frank , that it pains [me]110-grandon to discuss so serious a subject with one who makes so fair and earnest a pretence of having deep convictions as [you]0-i do , and whose acts are so diametrically opposed to them ; and now [I]110-grandon must be off , for [I]110-grandon have [a committee of [the House]2095-the house]2542-a committee of the house to attend . "[110-grandon] " And [I]0-i a rendezvous of a still more interesting character to keep ; "[0-i] and as [I]0-i left [Grandon]110-grandon [I]0-i observed a shade of disgust and disappointment cross [his]110-grandon face at [my]0-i last speech . [I]0-i always overdo it , [I]0-i thought , as [I]0-i walked towards [Grosvenor Square]42-grosvenor square , but [Grandon]110-grandon ought to make allowances for [me]0-i . [He]110-grandon has known [me]0-i all [my]0-i life , but it was reserved for [us]907-us both to be in love with [the same woman]908-the same woman to bring out the strong points in [each of [us]907-us]909-each of us . [Lavater]200-lavater says [you]910-you never know whether [a man]302-a man is [[your]910-you friend]2161-your friend until [you]910-you have divided an inheritance with [him]302-a man ; but it is a much more ticklish thing to go halves in [a woman]1960-a woman 's love . Never mind , [I]0-i will astonish [them]907-us both yet . Now then , to begin with [her]1960-a woman ; and [I]0-i boldly knocked at the door . [I]0-i found [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem in [[his]914-his own little den]915-his own little den . " It is all right , "[914-his] [he]914-his said , as [I]0-i entered ; " [I]914-his have told [Ursula]124-lady ursula [you]0-i are coming , and [she]124-lady ursula will see [you]0-i in [the drawing - room]331-the drawing - room . "[914-his] [I]0-i had not been for two minutes alone with [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula since [we]916-we parted at [Dickiefield]120-dickiefield ; indeed , when it is remembered that [my]0-i whole intercourse with [her]124-lady ursula upon that occasion extended over little more than twenty - four hours , and that [we]916-we had never been on any other terms since than those of [the most casual acquaintances]917-the most casual acquaintances , the embarrassing nature of the impending interview presented itself to [me]0-i in a somewhat unpleasant aspect . Now that it had come to the point , [I]0-i could not make up [my]0-i mind exactly what to say . [I]0-i tried to collect [my]0-i ideas and go over the history of the events which had resulted in the present predicament . Why was [I]0-i in the singular position of having to make a special appointment with [a young lady with whom [I]0-i was desperately in love , whom [I]0-i knew but slightly , but who supposed [me]0-i to be mad , for the purpose of asking [her]124-lady ursula , first , whether [she]124-lady ursula considered [herself]124-lady ursula engaged to be married to [me]0-i or not]918-a young lady with whom i was desperately in love , whom i knew but slightly , but who supposed me to be mad , for the purpose of asking her , first , whether she considered herself engaged to be married to me or not ; and secondly , if not , whether [she]124-lady ursula would have any objection to [the world]271-the world supposing that such was the case ? Now [[my]0-i readers]308-my readers will remember that the sudden impulse which induced [me]0-i in the first instance to delude [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem into believing that [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula had accepted [me]0-i , arose from the desire to save [her]124-lady ursula from the tender mercies of [Chundango]140-chundango . [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula had in fact owed the repose [she]124-lady ursula had enjoyed for the last two months entirely to [her]124-lady ursula supposed engagement to [me]0-i . The moment that is at an end , [her]124-lady ursula fate becomes miserable . If [she]124-lady ursula will but consider [herself]124-lady ursula drowning , and [me]0-i the straw , [I]0-i shall only be too happy to be clutched . If [I]0-i can not propose [myself]0-i as [a husband]921-a husband , [I]0-i will at least suggest that [she]124-lady ursula should regard [me]0-i in the light of a straw . [I]0-i had got thus far when [I]0-i found [myself]0-i in [her]124-lady ursula presence . [She]124-lady ursula looked very pale , and there was an expression of decision about the corners of [her]124-lady ursula mouth which [I]0-i had not before remarked . It did not detract from its sweetness , nor did the slight tremor of the upper lip as [she]124-lady ursula greeted [me]0-i detract from its force . It is a great mistake to suppose that a tremor of the lip denotes weakness ; on the contrary , it often arises from a concentration of nervous energy . [I]0-i am not quite so sure about a tremor of the knees . That was what [I]0-i suffered from at the moment , together with a very considerable palpitation of the heart . Now the difficulty at such a moment is to know how to begin . [I]0-i have often heard [men]1940-men say that when [they]1940-men have obtained an interview with [a great statesman]923-a great statesman for the purpose of asking a favour , and [he]923-a great statesman waits for [them]1940-men to begin without helping [them]1940-men out with a word , [they]1940-men have experienced this difficulty . That arises from the consciousness that [they]1940-men are sacrificing [their]1940-men self - respect to [their]1940-men " career . "[924-a statesman] If [they]1940-men would never go near [a statesman]924-a statesman except when [they]1940-men wanted to confer a favour upon [him]924-a statesman , [they]1940-men would have no difficulty in finding words . Fortunately [the great majority of [[our]926-our public employés]927-our public employés]925-the great majority of our public employés are not yet [hardened beggars like [the Neapolitans]201-the neapolitans]928-hardened beggars like the neapolitans , and are not , like [them]925-the great majority of our public employés , dead to any sentiment of shame upon these occasions , though it is to be feared that [they]925-the great majority of our public employés will soon become so . Then , as [I]0-i said before , [the Church]8-the church utterly ignores its duties in this respect . Of course [I]0-i was not thinking of all this as [I]0-i entered [the drawing - room]331-the drawing - room , but [I]0-i had thought it often before , and feel impelled to mention it now . [I]0-i think this arose from the extreme desire [I]0-i felt that [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula should not at that moment imagine that [I]0-i was mad . "[124-lady ursula] [She]982-she maintained [her]982-she self - possession perfectly until [she]982-she was obliged to allude to [my]0-i insanity , then [she]982-she dropped [her]982-she eyelids , and the colour for the first time rushed into [her]982-she cheeks as [she]982-she shrank from touching on this delicate subject . "[0-i] [I]0-i could not resist letting a certain tone of pique penetrate this speech , and the puzzled and pained expression of [Lady Ursula]124-lady ursula 's face afforded [me]0-i a sense of momentary gratification , of which [I]0-i speedily repented . "[0-i] and [I]0-i felt the old sensation coming over [me]0-i , and [my]0-i head beginning to swim . [I]0-i seemed groping for light and strength , and mechanically put out [my]0-i hand ; the soft touch of one placed gently in it thrilled through [my]0-i nerves with an indescribable current , and instantaneously the horrid feeling left [me]0-i , and [I]0-i emerged from the momentary torpor into which [I]0-i had fallen . "[0-i] " Allow no worldly consideration , however unselfish , either for [myself]124-lady ursula or [those dearest to [me]124-lady ursula]2557-those dearest to me , to induce [you]124-lady ursula to swerve from the course which truth and honour distinctly point out .
