"[124-lady ursula] O [[my]0-i hardened and material readers]1003-my hardened and material readers ! do n't suppose that because [I]0-i know [you]1004-you will laugh at the idea of a purifying or invigorating magnetism [I]0-i shall hesitate to write exactly what [I]0-i feel on such matters . If [I]0-i refrain from saying a great deal more , it is not because [I]0-i shrink from [your]1004-you ridicule but from [your]1004-you ignorance . [You]1004-you may not believe that the pearls exist ; [I]0-i honestly admit that they are not yet in [my]0-i possession , but [I]0-i have seen [those who own them]1005-those who own them , and , unfortunately , also [I]0-i have seen [the animals before whom they have been cast]1006-the animals before whom they have been cast . And [you]1004-you , [[my]0-i dear young ladies]1007-my dear young ladies , do not ignore the responsibility which the influence [you]1004-you are able to exercise over [young men]1974-young men imposes upon [you]1004-you . [You]1004-you need not call it magnetism unless [you]1004-you like , but be sure that there is that conveyed in a touch or a glance which elevates or degrades [him]1009-him upon whom it is bestowed , according as [you]1004-you preserve the purity and simplicity of [your]1004-you inmost natures . If [you]1004-you would only regard [yourselves]1004-you in the light of [female missionaries to [that benighted tribe of lavender - gloved young gentlemen who flutter about [you]1004-you]1011-that benighted tribe of lavender - gloved young gentlemen who flutter about you like moths round a candle , [you]1004-you would send [them]1012-them away glowing and happy , instead of singeing [their]1012-them wings]1010-female missionaries to that benighted tribe of lavender - gloved young gentlemen who flutter about you like moths round a candle , you would send them away glowing and happy , instead of singeing their wings . If , when these butterflies come to sip , [you]1004-you would give [them]1012-them honey instead of poison , [they]1012-them would not forsake [you]1004-you as [they]1012-them do now for the gaudy flowers which are too near [you]1004-you . [I]0-i know what [you]1004-you have to contend against — [the scheming mothers who bring [you]1004-you up to the " Daughticultural Show , "[0-i] labelled and decorated , and put up to competition as likely prize - winners — who deliberately expose [you]1004-you to the first rush of [your]1004-you first seasons , and mercilessly watch [you]1004-you as [you]1004-you are swept along by the tearing stream — who see [you]1004-you without compunction cast away on sandbanks of worldliness , where [you]1004-you remain till [you]1004-you become as " hard "[1004-you] and as " fast "[1004-you] as those [you]1004-you find stranded there before [you]1004-you]1013-the scheming mothers who bring you up to the " daughticultural show , " labelled and decorated , and put up to competition as likely prize - winners — who deliberately expose you to the first rush of your first seasons , and mercilessly watch you as you are swept along by the tearing stream — who see you without compunction cast away on sandbanks of worldliness , where you remain till you become as " hard " and as " fast " as those you find stranded there before you . Here [your]1004-you minds become properly , or rather improperly , opened . [You]1004-you hear , for the first time , to [your]1004-you astonishment , [young men]1974-young men talked of by [their]1974-young men Christian or nick names — [their]1974-young men domestic life canvassed , [their]1974-young men eligibility discussed , and the varied personal experiences through which [your]1004-you " hard and fast "[1974-young men] friends have passed , related . Then , better prepared for the rest of the voyage , [you]1004-you start again , and venture a little on [your]1004-you own account . What bold swimmers [you]1004-you are becoming now ! How [you]1004-you laugh and defy the rocks and reefs upon which [you]1004-you are ultimately destined to split ! Already [you]1004-you look back with surprise to the time when almost everything [you]1004-you heard shocked [you]1004-you . What an immense amount of unnecessary knowledge [you]1004-you have acquired since then , and how recklessly [you]1004-you display it ! Do [you]1004-you think it has softened and elevated [you]1004-you ? Do [you]1004-you think the moral contact which should be life - giving to those who know [you]1004-you , benefits [them]1974-young men ? It is not true , because [young men]1974-young men behave heartlessly , that [you]1004-you must flirt " in self - defence , "[1004-you] as [you]1004-you call it . When [a warfare of this kind]1016-a warfare of this kind once begins , it is difficult to fix the responsibility ; but if [one side]1017-one side left off , the occupation of [the other]1018-the other would be gone . If [you]1004-you want to revenge [yourselves]1004-you on [these fickle youths]1019-these fickle youths — strike ! as [they]1019-these fickle youths do in [the manufacturing districts]1020-the manufacturing districts . Conceive the wholesome panic [you]1004-you would cause , if [you]1004-you combined into " unions "[1019-these fickle youths] like [the working - classes]1021-the working - classes , and [every girl in [London]5-london]1022-every girl in london bound [herself]1022-every girl in london not to flirt for the entire season ! Unless [you]1004-you do something of this kind soon , [you]1004-you will reverse the whole system of nature . [The men]1023-the men will be the candles and [you]1004-you the moths ; they will be the flowers , and [you]1004-you the butterflies . If [all the brothers in [London]5-london]1024-all the brothers in london persist in trying to imitate [[their]1024-all the brothers in london sisters]1025-their sisters , and [all the sisters]1026-all the sisters ape [[their]1026-all the sisters brothers]1027-their brothers , what a nice confusion [we]1028-we shall arrive at ! The reason [I]0-i preach to [you]1004-you and not to [them]1004-you now , is , because [I]0-i think [I]0-i have a better chance with the mind of [a masculine young woman]1029-a masculine young woman than with that of [a feminine young man]1030-a feminine young man . If [you]1004-you only knew what a comfort it would be to talk sense instead of that incessant chaff , [you]1004-you would read a little more . [I]0-i do n't object to [your]1004-you riding in [the Park]2198-the park — the abominable constitution of society makes it almost the only opportunity of seeing and talking to those [you]1004-you like without being talked about ; but [you]1004-you need not rush off for a drive in [the carriage]1032-the carriage immediately after lunch , just because [you]1004-you are too restless to stay at [home]330-home . First , [the Park]2198-the park and [young men]1974-young men , then lunch , then [Marshall]205-marshall and [Snelgrove]72-snelgrove , then tea and [young men]1974-young men again , then dinner , drums , and balls , and [young men]1974-young men till three A.M. That is the tread - wheel [you]1004-you have chosen to turn without the smallest profit to [yourself]1004-you or [any one else]2533-any one else . If [I]0-i seem to speak strongly , it is because [my]0-i heart yearns over [you]1004-you . [We]1041-we shall be [warmer and closer friends]1042-warmer and closer friends ever after ; but [I]0-i am strongly afraid mamma will disapprove . [Piccadilly]7-piccadilly , [June]206-june . [Somebody]1879-somebody ought to compile a handbook for débutants and débutantes , setting forth the most approved modes of procuring invitations to balls and parties during the [London]5-london season . Not only would it be a very invaluable guide now , but it would be interesting for [posterity]1046-posterity to refer to as illustrating the manners and customs of [[their]1046-posterity ancestors]1047-their ancestors , and accounting for the hereditary taint of snobbism which is probably destined to characterise in an eminent degree [the population of [the British Isles]6-the british isles]1048-the population of the british isles . " En Angleterre , "[1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist] said [a cynical Dutch diplomatist]1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist , " numéro deux va chez numéro un , pour s'en glorifier auprès de numéro trois . "[1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist] Had [he]1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist gone to [the Bodwinkle ball]168-bodwinkle , [he]1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist would have remarked a curious inversion of [his]1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist aphorism , for there it was [numéro un]1050-numéro un who went down to numéro deux . But [I]0-i must leave it to [Van den Bosch]207-van den bosch ( that , [I]0-i think , was [his]207-van den bosch name ) to discover what there was to boast about to number three . [He]1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist was evidently [a profound philosopher]1051-a profound philosopher , but [I]0-i doubt [his]1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist getting to the bottom of this great social problem . To do so [he]1049-a cynical dutch diplomatist would have to look at it free from all petty prejudice , recognising its sublime as well as its ridiculous features . Why did [Duchesses]1052-duchesses struggle to be asked to Bodwinkle 's ? [I]0-i almost think a new phase of snobbism is cropping out , and the rivalry will be to try , not who can rise highest , but who can sink lowest , in the social scale . [The fashionable world]1053-the fashionable world is so blasé of [itself]1053-the fashionable world that [it]1053-the fashionable world has positively become tired of worshipping wealth , unless [its owners]1054-its owners possess the charm of extreme vulgarity . [Its]1053-the fashionable world taste has become so vitiated by being unnaturally excited and pandered to , that [we]1055-we shall have to invent some new object of ambition . Why , for instance , should not [a select clique of Oxford Street shopkeepers]1056-a select clique of oxford street shopkeepers give a series of parties which might become the rage for one season ? [They]1056-a select clique of oxford street shopkeepers have only to get [two or three leaders of [ton]1058-ton]1057-two or three leaders of ton to patronise [them]1056-a select clique of oxford street shopkeepers at first , and be very exclusive and select in [their]1056-a select clique of oxford street shopkeepers invitations afterwards , to insure success . Talk of sermons in stones ! they are nothing to the sermons contained in drums and balls . First , [I]0-i have already let [[my]0-i readers]308-my readers into the secret history of that ball . ' " [I]219-wild harrie must here remark en passant that [Spiffy]159-spiffy is apparently capable of doing the most unselfish things , and of taking an infinity of trouble upon [himself]159-spiffy out of pure good - nature . "[219-wild harrie] What was [your]219-wild harrie modus operandi ? " [I]219-wild harrie asked . "[219-wild harrie] Oh , it was all plain sailing enough . The first thing to provide was [a popular chaperon]1128-a popular chaperon , and the second a special reputation . Now [Harrie]219-wild harrie is [a wonderful rider]1129-a wonderful rider , and knows a horse thoroughly . If [you]1926-sir will cast [your]1926-sir eye down [the stair]1226-the stair [you]1926-sir will observe [a young person on the landing]1227-a young person on the landing , the parting of whose hair , for the space of one inch on either side , is black , while the two large bunches on [her]1227-a young person on the landing temples are red . " said [that spiteful old Lady [Catchpole]226-catchpole , whose eyes twinkled with malice as [she]226-catchpole explained to [Mr Wog]131-mr wog that , when the hair had been thoroughly dyed it could only recover its natural colour by this slow process , but that usually the effect was concealed by a postiche ; and [she]226-catchpole looked hard at [Lady Veriphast]115-lady veriphast , whose hair was suspiciously crep — , and who wished it to be supposed that [she]226-catchpole blushed because [she]226-catchpole was still under the pressure of [the Asiatic ambassador]2640-the asiatic ambassador]2639-that spiteful old lady catchpole , whose eyes twinkled with malice as she explained to mr wog that , when the hair had been thoroughly dyed it could only recover its natural colour by this slow process , but that usually the effect was concealed by a postiche ; and she looked hard at lady veriphast , whose hair was suspiciously crep — , and who wished it to be supposed that she blushed because she was still under the pressure of the asiatic ambassador . "[0-i] What is the exact meaning of the term postiche ? ' " And this consideration reminds [me]116-lord frank that [I]116-lord frank possess [middle - class readers , who may positively doubt the truth of the picture which [I]116-lord frank am endeavouring to give [them]2651-middle - class readers , who may positively doubt the truth of the picture which i am endeavouring to give them of the society in which mrs bodwinkle now found herself of [the society in which [Mrs Bodwinkle]168-bodwinkle now found [herself]168-bodwinkle]2652-the society in which mrs bodwinkle now found herself]2651-middle - class readers , who may positively doubt the truth of the picture which i am endeavouring to give them of the society in which mrs bodwinkle now found herself . [[My]116-lord frank dear readers]2655-my dear readers , [I]116-lord frank should be no more competent to invent a state of society so eccentric in its habits and constitution as this of [London]5-london cream , than [I]116-lord frank should be to write an account of lion - hunting like the late lamented [Jules Gerard]230-jules gerard . That was a real strain upon the imaginative and constructive faculties ; [I]116-lord frank aspire to no such talent , but simply contemplate hyperbolically a certain phase of contemporary civilisation . If , by way of a little pastime , [I]116-lord frank put [Mayfair]49-mayfair into a fancy dress , it only appears in its true colours and becomes fancy - fair , with a great deal of show and very little substance ; so [I]116-lord frank dress it up as it pleases [me]116-lord frank , but [I]116-lord frank invent nothing . [I]116-lord frank confine [myself]116-lord frank strictly to the stage properties . [You]2655-my dear readers in the pit or [gallery]2656-gallery may be too far off to see , but [I]116-lord frank assure [you]2655-my dear readers [I]116-lord frank have avoided anything beyond the exaggeration permissible in a caricature . As [I]116-lord frank know [your]2655-my dear readers imitative faculties , [dear middle classes]2657-dear middle classes , [I]116-lord frank can conscientiously assure [you]2655-my dear readers that [you]2655-my dear readers may take ' Piccadilly ' as a guide upon which to frame [[your]2655-my dear readers own society]2658-your own society . Take [the most successful costermonger of the neighbourhood]2659-the most successful costermonger of the neighbourhood and erect [him]2659-the most successful costermonger of the neighbourhood into a Bodwinkle , and fall down upon [your]2655-my dear readers knees before [the most opulent pawnbroker of [[your]2655-my dear readers parish]2661-your parish]2660-the most opulent pawnbroker of your parish ; and [you]2655-my dear readers will feel that [you]2655-my dear readers are only performing , on a humble scale , the same act of worship as those above [you]2655-my dear readers . " "[168-bodwinkle] Of course , all in the most perfect confidence ; it would never do for [Stepton]233-stepton to suspect what [we]1293-we were at . " "[233-stepton] Oh , it would be absolute ruin . " "[168-bodwinkle] Eh ! " said [Bodwinkle]168-bodwinkle , with [his]2673-his eyes rather wide open . "[0-i] [I]0-i have four things to consider — [[my]0-i country]1303-my country , [[my]0-i party]1304-my party , [[my]0-i family]1305-my family , and [my]0-i conscience . [I]0-i begin by asking [my]0-i conscience what are the interests of [[my]0-i country]1303-my country . [My]0-i conscience replies promptly that [[my]0-i party]1304-my party should be in power . [I]0-i then ask [my]0-i conscience what are the interests of [[my]0-i family]1305-my family , and [my]0-i conscience invariably says the same thing . [I]0-i then ask [my]0-i conscience whether it has any political views of [its]1309-its own , and [my]0-i conscience responds that it is a mercantile conscience , which has always been absorbed in commerce , and that takes no interest in abstract politics ; so that practically , [you]1310-you see , [I]0-i have no difficulty , so far as [my]0-i conscience is concerned . " "[131-mr wog] [Wog]131-mr wog is right , " [I]131-mr wog mused as [I]131-mr wog walked home—"postiche[131-mr wog] is everywhere . [We]1311-we certainly do ' make up ' well . [I]0-i suppose [this country]1901-this country never looked more fair and flourishing in the eyes of [the world]271-the world in general than it does at this moment . [We]1311-we have made a great succès by means of postiche — there is no denying it . But [we]1311-we shall fall to pieces all of a sudden like [old Lady Pimlico]227-lady pimlico ; and the wrinkles will appear before long in the national cheeks in spite of the rouge . Ah , the taunts [we]1311-we shall have to endure when the postiche is discovered , from [the rivals that have always been jealous and are still under the prestige of [our]1311-we former charms]1314-the rivals that have always been jealous and are still under the prestige of our former charms ! Is there [no one who will cry aloud]1317-no one who will cry aloud in [the streets]1318-the streets while there is yet time?—will there not be one man in these coming elections who will have the courage to tell [the people]2251-the people that [their]2251-the people senses are so drugged by prosperity that [they]2251-the people are blind to the impending doom , and that the only way to avert it will be by a policy diametrically opposed to that which has fascinated [the nation]2056-the nation for the last few years , because it has conducted [them]2251-the people so pleasantly along those smooth and flowery paths that lead to destruction ? Be sure , oh [[my]0-i countrymen]1180-my countrymen , that for [you]1180-my countrymen collectively , as well as individually , there is a broad and a narrow way , and that as surely as [a nation]593-a nation ignores [its]593-a nation duties towards [God]130-god and [its]593-a nation obligations towards [[its]593-a nation neighbours]1323-its neighbours , so surely will a swift judgment overtake it ! " [I]0-i was interrupted by [a policeman]2674-a policeman at this point , who kindly called [my]0-i attention to the fact that in [my]0-i prophetic fervour [I]0-i had [myself]0-i been crying aloud in [the streets]1318-the streets , and accompanying [my]0-i denunciations with appropriate action . "[607-gentlemen] [Gentlemen]607-gentlemen , " says [Spiffy]159-spiffy to [the independent electors of [Shuffleborough]97-shuffleborough]2676-the independent electors of shuffleborough , "[607-gentlemen] in soliciting the favour of [your]607-gentlemen suffrages at the approaching general election , [I]0-i am aware that [I]0-i labour under the disadvantage of coming before [you]607-gentlemen as [an untried man]1326-an untried man , but [I]0-i ask [you]607-gentlemen all the more confidently on this account to substitute [me]0-i for [one who has been tried and found wanting]1327-one who has been tried and found wanting . [Gentlemen]607-gentlemen , [I]0-i regret to say that in some instances [the members of that party]1330-the members of that party have not been true to the principles which [they]1330-the members of that party profess , and have issued addresses almost identical in the terms [they]1330-the members of that party employ and in the measures [they]1330-the members of that party advocate with those of [the Liberal Conservative party]1331-the liberal conservative party . As [a friend of [the people]2251-the people]1334-a friend of the people [I]0-i am opposed to all compromises , and will unflinchingly expose treachery in the camp . [You]607-gentlemen will find that [my]0-i political views are clear and decided . " Though [a member of [the Church of England]99-the church of england]2677-a member of the church of england , [I]0-i am in favour of the total abolition of Church - rates , as [I]0-i believe that [you]607-gentlemen will spiritualise [the Church]1861-the church precisely in proportion as [you]607-gentlemen starve it . "[0-i] [I]0-i am in favour of an extension of the franchise to such an extent as will comprise [all the working - classes]1336-all the working - classes , and thus pave the way to that universal suffrage in which [I]0-i [myself]0-i shall be included , and for the first time enjoy the privilege of voting . " Should [I]0-i fail to be returned as [[your]607-gentlemen member]2679-your member upon this occasion , [I]0-i shall be in favour of a redistribution of seats . "[0-i] [I]0-i believe that an era of universal peace is dawning upon [the world]271-the world , and [I]0-i am therefore an advocate of the total suppression of [our]1338-our armaments both by [sea]1339-sea and [land]1340-land . " T think that the Christian spirit displayed in [our]1338-our foreign policy which has induced [us]1338-our to court national insult for the purpose of setting an example of forbearance , and which has enabled [us]1338-our humbly but surely to extend [our]1338-our commercial relations , has procured for [us]1338-our the highest moral position which has ever yet been accorded to [a people]2680-a people . "[168-bodwinkle] Now comes [Bodwinkle]168-bodwinkle 's address , written by [the versatile author of the last]1341-the versatile author of the last : — " Gentlemen,—The appearance of [a third candidate in the Liberal interest]2685-a third candidate in the liberal interest within the last few days induces [me]0-i to break the silence which [I]0-i have up to this time preserved . [I]0-i have observed with pain that in many instances the addresses issued by gentlemen calling [themselves]2686-themselves [Liberal Conservatives]2687-liberal conservatives or [Conservative Reformers]2688-conservative reformers , are of the most subversive tendency , and entirely opposed to the spirit of [that old and enlightened party to which [I]0-i have the honour to belong]2689-that old and enlightened party to which i have the honour to belong . [I]0-i repudiate , therefore , entirely that temporising language which a large number of candidates calling [themselves]2686-themselves [Conservatives]2690-conservatives hold , and which it has suited one of [[my]0-i opponents]2691-my opponents , who calls [himself]2692-himself [a Liberal]2693-a liberal , to adopt . [I]0-i believe [I]0-i shall best recommend [myself]0-i to [this constituency]2694-this constituency by an honest and unswerving advocacy of those views which [the Tory party of [this country]1901-this country]2695-the tory party of this country have invariably maintained . More fondly attached , if possible , to [the Church of [England]10-england]2697-the church of england than [I]0-i was upon the occasion when [I]0-i last addressed [you]2698-you , [I]0-i am more than ever convinced that money is the only thing that keeps it going . [I]0-i am therefore entirely opposed to the abolition of those rates which form the foundation of that pillar upon which [the State]590-the state has been accustomed securely to repose . "[0-i] [I]0-i am opposed to the enfranchisement of [the working man]1342-the working man , as , in the probable event of a combination between [the labouring classes]1343-the labouring classes and [the aristocracy]587-the aristocracy , [that middle class to which [I]0-i have the honour to belong]1345-that middle class to which i have the honour to belong would cease to direct the destinies of [the country]1937-the country . Any lateral measure of reform , unattended , however , by a vertical movement , which should exclude this possibility , will have [my]0-i entire concurrence . " [I]0-i am in favour of a measure which shall largely increase the armaments of [the country]1937-the country , and at the same time reduce the cost of [their]1347-the great conservative party maintenance . "[0-i] [I]0-i have profound confidence in the policy of [the great Conservative party]1347-the great conservative party in [their]1347-the great conservative party relations with [foreign nations]1348-foreign nations . The fact that [they]1347-the great conservative party have hitherto declined to define what that policy is , renders it impossible for [me]0-i to enter more fully into this subject at present . " In a word , should [you]2701-you do [me]1347-the great conservative party the honour to return [me]1347-the great conservative party as [[your]2701-you member]2679-your member , [you]2701-you will find [me]1347-the great conservative party Liberal only in [my]1347-the great conservative party views as to the modes in which money may be acquired , and Conservative always when there is a question of expenditure . "[1347-the great conservative party] It is a grand idea but a great experiment this of having convictions , which [Spiffy]159-spiffy has just started , thought [I.]0-i [I]0-i have been cursed with them all [my]0-i life , but never could turn [them]1347-the great conservative party to account . [I]0-i shall issue an address to [the free and independent electors of [Dunderhead]35-dunderhead]1352-the free and independent electors of dunderhead . And under the inspiration of the moment [I]0-i wrote as follows : — " [Gentlemen,—In]2703-gentlemen,—in announcing [my]0-i intention not to solicit [your]2703-gentlemen,—in suffrages at the approaching general election , [I]0-i feel that it is due to [you]2703-gentlemen,—in that [I]0-i should state the reason why [I]0-i do not again seek the high honour which [you]2703-gentlemen,—in have upon two previous occasions conferred upon [me]0-i , of representing [you]2703-gentlemen,—in in [Parliament]2704-parliament . The prosperity of [the country]1937-the country is now so great that [I]0-i feel it has no further need of [my]0-i services . In default of any great question of national importance , [the rival political parties]2706-the rival political parties are reduced to the lamentable predicament of having nothing to fight for except office . As [I]0-i have never taken the slightest interest in the fortunes of [either party]2707-either party , except as embodying or representing the triumph of certain principles , the disappearance of those principles , and the difficulty of distinguishing by [their]2706-the rival political parties expressed opinions between one party and the other , renders it quite impossible for [me]0-i to follow the example of [the candidates on both sides]2708-the candidates on both sides , and to stand upon — nothing ! [Gentlemen]607-gentlemen , [I]0-i have no doubt that before very long something will turn up for [me]0-i to stand upon . [I]0-i will wait till then . Meantime , [I]0-i feel that to profess any decided convictions upon matters either of [home]330-home or foreign politics at this juncture would be considered in bad taste , if not impertinent , and [I]0-i shall therefore reserve whatever [I]0-i have to say for a future occasion , when the exigencies of [the country]1937-the country may render it absolutely necessary that [some individual in it]2712-some individual in it should have an opinion . "[0-i] There , [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i need say anything more . [I]0-i was much puzzled what to do about [Grandon]110-grandon . At last [I]0-i began to think [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's silence rather ominous . [I]0-i think [a man]302-a man , even though [he]302-a man does not approve of racing , ought to have seen it once — don't [you]166-lady broadhem ? " "[302-a man] Certainly , " said [I]302-a man , "[302-a man] especially when [you]166-lady broadhem can see [Wild Harrie]219-wild harrie at the same time . " "[0-i] [I]0-i say , " said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , and [he]302-a man stopped short . "[0-i] Well ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i wish to goodness there was some way of going to [Ascot]101-ascot without being seen . [I]0-i suppose one is sure to come across [a lot of [men one]1374-men one knows]1373-a lot of men one knows . " "[1375-the clergyman of the parish] Not if [you]166-lady broadhem go and stay with [the clergyman of [the parish]1376-the parish]1375-the clergyman of the parish , " [I]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know [him]1375-the clergyman of the parish . It is not for [myself]0-i , but [I]0-i do n't think [[my]0-i mother]417-my mother would like [my]0-i going . " "[417-my mother] Then do n't go . " "[417-my mother] What [an unsatisfactory fellow]1378-an unsatisfactory fellow [you]166-lady broadhem are ! [I]0-i shall go and talk over the matter with [Ursula]124-lady ursula — [she]124-lady ursula always helps [me]0-i out of [my]0-i difficulties . " "[124-lady ursula] What does [she]124-lady ursula know about [Ascot]101-ascot ? " [I]124-lady ursula asked . "[124-lady ursula] Oh , [she]124-lady ursula does not know about [Ascot]101-ascot , but somehow or other [she]124-lady ursula always tells [me]0-i what is the best thing to do about everything . " "[124-lady ursula] [I]0-i suppose , then , [you]166-lady broadhem tell [her]124-lady ursula everything ? " "[166-lady broadhem] Almost , " [he]2729-him said . "[166-lady broadhem] Take [my]0-i advice , and make a clean breast of it , [[my]0-i [dear boy]1380-dear boy]1379-my dear boy ; " and [I]124-lady ursula felt kindly towards [him]2729-him for the way [he]2729-him spoke about [[his]2729-him sister]759-his sister . "[124-lady ursula] Depend upon it , no half confidences do in such a case . [I]0-i had never cared about [him]2729-him for [his]2729-him own sake , but [my]0-i heart warmed towards [him]2729-him for [hers]124-lady ursula .[0-i]

[Piccadilly]7-piccadilly , July 1 . [I]0-i am now about to venture upon the very thinnest ice upon which [fool]1381-fool ever rushed . The fact is , [I]0-i am morally trembling like an aspen ; but [somebody]1879-somebody must do it . [I]0-i have put it off for five months , and tried to work up [my]0-i courage by hammering away at the fashionable world , but [they]1383-they take it like lambs . [Dear people]1384-dear people , whatever [their]1384-dear people vices may be , [they]1384-dear people never resent criticism . Whether [their]1384-dear people consciences tell [them]1384-dear people [they]1384-dear people are superior to it , or whether [they]1384-dear people have not got consciences , [I]0-i do n't know , but , on the whole , [the fashionable world]1053-the fashionable world is [an easy , good - natured world]1386-an easy , good - natured world ; but oh , not so that other world , which is still essentially " [the world]271-the world , "[0-i] and very necessary to keep unspotted from , though it is thankful that it is not as [that other world]1387-that other world is , from which in [its]1387-that other world humility it takes care to distinguish [itself]1387-that other world by the self - applied epithet of " religious . "[0-i] It grieves [me]0-i to think of [the number of [[my]0-i friends]305-my friends whom [I]0-i shall pain by presuming to touch upon this subject , to say nothing of the righteous indignation [I]0-i shall call down from [those whose function it has been to give , not take , reproof]1390-those whose function it has been to give , not take , reproof]1388-the number of my friends whom i shall pain by presuming to touch upon this subject , to say nothing of the righteous indignation i shall call down from those whose function it has been to give , not take , reproof . The great art of the " worldly - holies"—not[0-i] , [I]0-i believe , deliberately practised , but insensibly acquired — is to confuse in the minds of [the poor dear " wholly - worldlies]2732-the poor dear " wholly - worldlies "[0-i] the sublime religion which [they]1384-dear people profess , with [their]1384-dear people mode of professing it . So [they]1384-dear people would have it to be understood that , when [you]1391-you find fault with [their]1384-dear people practices , [you]1391-you are reflecting upon that very religion , the precepts of which [they]1384-dear people seem to some utterly to ignore . [The " religious world]2733-the " religious world "[720-women] is no more composed of [exclusively good men]1392-exclusively good men and [women]720-women than [the Episcopalian Church]1394-the episcopalian church is . [I]0-i will even venture to go further , and say that [the good men]1395-the good men and [women in]1396-women in [it]1397-it are [a very small minority , judging only from the public performances of the " worldly - holies "[720-women] in matters in which humility , sincerity , self - sacrifice , and toleration , are concerned]1398-a very small minority , judging only from the public performances of the " worldly - holies " in matters in which humility , sincerity , self - sacrifice , and toleration , are concerned . And if [you]1391-you want a proof of it , ask [[your]1391-you friends]1399-your friends in [the religious world]509-the religious world if [they]1399-your friends agree in what [I]0-i say of it , and [the very few [you]1391-you may find who do]1401-the very few you may find who do , will be [that small minority of whom [I]0-i speak]1402-that small minority of whom i speak . [I]0-i am perfectly ready to admit that [I]0-i have no more right to preach to [them]1399-your friends than [they]1399-your friends have to preach to [me]0-i . [I]0-i only ask [those among [them]1399-your friends who are sincere]1403-those among them who are sincere , to believe that [I]0-i am actuated by the same desire to improve [them]1399-your friends that [they]1399-your friends are to do good to [me]0-i . It is not merely in [their]1399-your friends own interest , but in the interest of [[their]1399-your friends fellow - men]1404-their fellow - men , that [I]0-i venture to write thus , and to point out to [them]1399-your friends that , if [they]1399-your friends " lived the life , "[0-i] instead of talking the talk , [they]1399-your friends might attract instead of repelling that other world which [they]1399-your friends condemn . It is not living the life to form a select and exclusive society , with its vanities and its excitements , and its scandals and its envyings and jealousies , which keeps itself aloof from [the worldly world]1405-the worldly world , on the ground that it professes and represents a religion of love . [Those who sit in [Moses]243-moses ' seat]1406-those who sit in moses ' seat are not on that account examples of the " life ; "[1407-the pharisee] on the contrary , " whatsoever [they]1406-those who sit in moses ' seat bid [you]2734-you observe , that observe and do ; but do not ye after [their]1406-those who sit in moses ' seat works , for [they]1406-those who sit in moses ' seat say and do not . "[1407-the pharisee] Above all , do not confound [the Pharisee]1407-the pharisee with the religion , or suppose that an attack on the one in any way implies irreverence towards the other . This is a very important distinction to make , as [I]0-i am about to describe a religious entertainment at [Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's with the religion left out , which will draw down upon [me]0-i much odium . There is , in fact , no stronger proof of the force and despotic power of [the Phariseeism of the present day]1408-the phariseeism of the present day , than the unpopularity which one incurs by attempting to expose it . [Christians]1409-christians , in the real sense of the term , were always told to expect persecution and now , as in old time , the quarter from which it comes is [the religious world]509-the religious world . It is a hard saying , and one which , unfortunately , [nobody]579-nobody has yet been found worthy to prove ; but whenever [he]243-moses comes into [this city of]1412-this city of [London]5-london , who can embody in [himself]243-moses the life and live it , [he]243-moses will be repudiated by the " worldly holies . "[2773-the hypocrites "] [The Bishop of [the Caribbee Islands]136-joseph]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands will give some account of the mission - work in [[his]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands diocese]1257-his diocese . " That was the form of the card ; and at nine punctually [I]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands responded to the invitation which it contained . For the benefit of [those of [[my]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands readers who have never been admitted within the sacred precincts of [the religious world]509-the religious world]2738-my readers who have never been admitted within the sacred precincts of the religious world]2737-those of my readers who have never been admitted within the sacred precincts of the religious world , [I]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands should tell [them]2738-my readers who have never been admitted within the sacred precincts of the religious world that there is nothing in [their]2738-my readers who have never been admitted within the sacred precincts of the religious world outward appearance to distinguish [them]2738-my readers who have never been admitted within the sacred precincts of the religious world from [the other world]2740-the other world . [The old ladies]2741-the old ladies come in , followed by trains of [daughters]2416-daughters , furbelowed and flounced by [the same dressmakers who clothe [worldly people]2283-worldly people]2743-the same dressmakers who clothe worldly people ; but there is a greater variety of [men]1940-men — [the older ones]2746-the older ones are often snuffy , and look unwashed . [They]2746-the older ones constantly wear thick boots , and [their]2746-the older ones black waistcoats are not embroidered , and button higher up , which gives [them]2746-the older ones a more staid appearance . [They]2746-the older ones are generally pervaded by an air of complacency and calm superiority , and converse in measured unctuous accents , checkered by beaming smiles when they are not contradicted . [The youths]2747-the youths , on the other hand , present in most cases an intellectually weak aspect . [They]2747-the youths are quite as much addicted to flirting with [the young ladies]636-the young ladies as if [they]2747-the youths belonged to [the other world]2740-the other world , but want that hardihood , not to say impertinence , which characterises [the lavender - gloved tribe who are still heathens]2750-the lavender - gloved tribe who are still heathens . The arrangement of [the room]2119-the room is somewhat that of a private concert , only instead of a piano is a table , behind which are seated [Joseph Caribbee Islands]136-joseph , [Chundango]140-chundango , and [several other lay and clerical performers]2752-several other lay and clerical performers . In the centre of this table is a vase , which [Joseph]136-joseph hopes to see filled with subscriptions before the proceedings terminate . There is a suspicion , however , that things may not go off quite smoothly , as [a lay member present]2753-a lay member present , who does a good deal of amateur preaching , intends to take [him]136-joseph to task about certain unsound views which [we]2754-we knew [[our]2754-we friend]2070-our friend [Joseph]136-joseph entertains . [I]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands am sorry to say that some of [the young gentlemen leaning in the doorway]2756-the young gentlemen leaning in the doorway , where [I]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands stand , anticipate this encounter with apparent satisfaction . Among [them]2747-the youths is [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , who has never once taken [his]136-joseph eyes off [Wild Harrie]219-wild harrie . [That young lady]2757-that young lady is more plainly dressed than anybody else in [the room]2119-the room . [Her]2757-that young lady hair is neatly and modestly drawn back . [She]2757-that young lady might have risked a larger chignon , but [she]2757-that young lady had never been to an entertainment of this kind before , and did not know how [they]2752-several other lay and clerical performers dressed ; [her]2757-that young lady eyes are only now and then furtively raised , and [she]2757-that young lady takes a quick glance round [the room]2119-the room , winding up with [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem ; and a twitching at the corners of [her]2757-that young lady mouth makes [me]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands envy [Amy Rumsort]216-amy rumsort , who will , no doubt , receive a most graphic and embellished report of the whole affair . There is a good deal of murmuring and rustling and getting into places , and [a few hardy men]2760-a few hardy men manage to squeeze [themselves]2760-a few hardy men next the crinoline of [their]2760-a few hardy men especial desire , and then [they]2760-a few hardy men go on whispering and tittering to each other , till [Joseph]136-joseph says in a very loud tone — Ahem ! On which a general silence . It seems as impossible and incongruous for [me]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands to write here what now takes place , as it did at the time to take part in it . It requires no stretch of imagination on the part of [[my]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands readers]308-my readers to divine what movement it was which caused the next general rustle . Remember that [a great proportion of [these young ladies]2763-these young ladies]2762-a great proportion of these young ladies were brought [here]2005-here by [[their]2762-a great proportion of these young ladies mammas]2765-their mammas , and in [their]2762-a great proportion of these young ladies secret souls would have rather been at a ball ; but [[their]2762-a great proportion of these young ladies mammas]2765-their mammas disapproved of balls , and made [them]2762-a great proportion of these young ladies do this instead . Now , tell [me]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands , which was most wrong ? [I]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands knew of [one young lady]2767-one young lady , at least , whose object in coming was not to do what [she]2767-one young lady was then doing . How many [young men]1974-young men would have been there had there been [no young ladies]2769-no young ladies ? and what were [they]1974-young men all thinking about now ? And as [I]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands looked at the subscription - vase , and listened to the monotonous voice of [a "[1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands] dear Christian friend " behind it , who had been called upon to open the proceedings]2770-a " dear christian friend " behind it , who had been called upon to open the proceedings , [I]1415-they thought , Can it be possible that these are [those of whom it is said]2771-those of whom it is said , "[1415-they] [they]1415-they devour [[widows]2601-widows ' houses]1417-widows ' houses , and for a pretence make long prayer " ? Can it be possible to put anything into that vase without the right hand knowing what the left hand is doing , and all [the people seeing both hands]2772-the people seeing both hands ? Is not "[1415-they] the trumpet " even now being "[1415-they] sounded " by "[1415-they] [the hypocrites "]2773-the hypocrites " that [they]1415-they may have "[1940-men] glory of [men]1940-men " ? Is there , in fact , any difference , practically , between kneeling in [[Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's drawing - room]2774-lady broadhem 's drawing - room , by way of an after - dinner entertainment , and loving "[1940-men] to pray standing in [the synagogues]2114-the synagogues , and in the corners of [the streets]1318-the streets , that [you]1421-you may be seen of [men]1940-men " ? Is there any part of [a clergyman]1263-a clergyman 's dress called a phylactery ; and if so , when [he]1263-a clergyman becomes [a bishop]1862-a bishop , does the hem of it become broader ? and if it was wrong for [a priest in [Jerusalem]102-jerusalem]2777-a priest in jerusalem , eighteen hundred years ago , to be called "[1423-rabbi] [Rabbi]1423-rabbi , [Rabbi]1423-rabbi , " is it less wrong for one in [London]5-london now to be called "[1423-rabbi] [[My]0-i lord]2022-my lord , [[My]0-i lord]2022-my lord " ? [I]1423-rabbi was thinking how much more usefully [Bishop Colenso]125-bishop would have been employed in pointing out those anomalies in the practice of [his]125-bishop religion , instead of the discrepancies in its records , and what a much stronger case [the Zulu]2778-the zulu might have made out against [Christians]1409-christians if [he]125-bishop had known as much of [the countries which [they]1409-christians inhabit]2780-the countries which they inhabit as [I]1423-rabbi do , when the rustling again became general , and the monotonous voice ceased . "[1423-rabbi] [Dear Christian friends]1898-dear christian friends , " began [Joseph]136-joseph — and here [I]1423-rabbi may remark that this epithet is only applied by the worldly - holies to [one another]2195-one another — one of the chief characteristics of [those who belong to the religious world]2782-those who belong to the religious world being constantly to talk as though [they]2782-those who belong to the religious world were [a privileged few]2783-a privileged few , a chosen flock , and as though that new commandment , "[1423-rabbi] that [ye]1428-i love [one another]2195-one another , " was applicable only as among [themselves]2782-those who belong to the religious world , and consisted chiefly in addressing [one another]2195-one another in affectionate and complimentary terms . Even these [they]2782-those who belong to the religious world withhold , not merely from [the wholly - worldlies]2785-the wholly - worldlies , but from those who differ from [them]2782-those who belong to the religious world upon all points of doctrine which [they]2782-those who belong to the religious world assume to be vital . Hence , by constantly toadying and flattering [each other]320-each other , [they]2782-those who belong to the religious world insensibly foster that description of pride which apes humility , and acquire that air of subdued arrogance which is so displeasing to society at large . So when [Joseph]136-joseph said , "[1428-i] [Dear Christian friends]1898-dear christian friends , " there was clearly written on the self - satisfied faces of [most of [the audience]2788-the audience]2787-most of the audience , "[1898-dear christian friends] that is the least [you]1428-i can say of [us]1431-us , " or words to that effect . Now let [me]1428-i in a little more detail tell who [some of [these friends]2790-these friends]2789-some of these friends were . The religious world in [London]5-london being [a very large and well - to - do world]2791-a very large and well - to - do world , [they]2782-those who belong to the religious world want [religious lawyers]2792-religious lawyers , and [religious bankers]2793-religious bankers , and [religious doctors]2794-religious doctors ; [they]2782-those who belong to the religious world like to get [their]2782-those who belong to the religious world wine from [somebody who holds sound views]2795-somebody who holds sound views , but [I]1428-i think [they]2782-those who belong to the religious world cease to be so particular about the principles of those from whom [they]2782-those who belong to the religious world get [their]2782-those who belong to the religious world bonnets . However that may be about trades , the demand is immediately met in all the professions , and [young men starting in life with a "[1428-i] connection " in the religious world]2796-young men starting in life with a " connection " in the religious world must belong to it if [they]2796-young men starting in life with a " connection " in the religious world wish to succeed . This is another anomaly . In former times it involved stripes , persecution , poverty , and contumely to be [a "[1428-i] Christian]2797-a " christian , " but [a "[1428-i] dear Christian friend " of the present day]2798-a " dear christian friend " of the present day need be afraid of none of these things . [He]2798-a " dear christian friend " of the present day would never be called mad for making a profession of the views of [the early Christians]2799-the early christians ; but [he]2798-a " dear christian friend " of the present day would if , with a good religious opening in a professional point of view , [he]2798-a " dear christian friend " of the present day declined to take advantage of it . Then look what society it gets [you]2800-you into — [you]2800-you become [a sort of brother]2801-a sort of brother ; and , [I]1428-i am sorry to say , [I]1428-i know [several young men who saw no chance of getting into the fashionable world , and who took to the other as a good introduction]2802-several young men who saw no chance of getting into the fashionable world , and who took to the other as a good introduction . [He]2803-the son of a solicitor i knew at dunderhead , who was in the office of his uncle , who was lady broadhem 's solicitor has just invited [me]1432-ladies on the part of [[his]2803-the son of a solicitor i knew at dunderhead , who was in the office of his uncle , who was lady broadhem 's solicitor uncle]2804-his uncle to a conversazione , at which will be exhibited [a converted Aztec]2811-a converted aztec , and at which [that Christian solicitor , whose wife]2812-that christian solicitor , whose wife is [a fat woman fanning herself in the front row]2813-a fat woman fanning herself in the front row , will positively induce the great majority of [those now here]2814-those now here , including a fair sprinkling of [persons with titles]2815-persons with titles , to be present . Now far be it from [me]1432-ladies to imply that there are not earnest , sincere , and to some extent self - sacrificing , [professors of the Christian religion]2816-professors of the christian religion , who [I]1432-ladies know will persist in mistaking [me]1432-ladies , and imagine that by writing this [I]1432-ladies bring the religion itself into contempt . [I]1432-ladies say again that [those who bring it into the most contempt]2817-those who bring it into the most contempt are [those who profess it most]2818-those who profess it most , and that it is to counteract [their]2817-those who bring it into the most contempt prejudicial influence upon [society]297-society that [I]1432-ladies venture to incur [their]2817-those who bring it into the most contempt animosity . [I]1432-ladies shall not report [Joseph]136-joseph 's speech at length , still less attempt to follow [Chundango]140-chundango in [his]140-chundango unctuous remarks , in the course of which [he]140-chundango lavished flattery upon [[his]140-chundango audience]2820-his audience to an extent even beyond what [they]2820-his audience could bear ; [they]2820-his audience swallowed it , however , with tea and ices , which were handed round , but [I]1432-ladies got so worked up at last by [a smooth - faced man who was describing what [he]140-chundango had gone through for the sake of [the heathen]387-the heathen]2821-a smooth - faced man who was describing what he had gone through for the sake of the heathen , while [he]140-chundango was living luxuriously in [one of [the most charming little mission establishments which [I]1432-ladies have ever visited]2824-the most charming little mission establishments which i have ever visited]2823-one of the most charming little mission establishments which i have ever visited , that [I]1432-ladies made the following remarks : — "[1432-ladies] [Ladies]1432-ladies and [Gentlemen,—When]1433-gentlemen,—when [I]0-i came here this evening nothing was farther from [my]0-i purpose than to address [you]1434-you . " [The Bishop of [the Caribbee Islands]136-joseph]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands , in the course of the very graphic account which [he]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands has given [you]1434-you of the progress of conversion in [[his]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands diocese]1257-his diocese , and of the number of interesting and instructive deathbeds which [he]1255-the bishop of the caribbee islands has witnessed , has entered into a calculation by which it would appear that the average cost of the conversion of [a human soul]2827-a human soul in [those islands]2828-those islands is a little over — 6 . [Ladies]1432-ladies , [you]1434-you pretend to believe that , but [you]1434-you do n't . It would be impossible for [you]1434-you to sit there with strings of [lost human souls]2830-lost human souls round [your]1434-you necks , and what would keep [an infant school]2831-an infant school in each ear , if [you]1434-you really believed that [you]1434-you could save a soul for — 6 . [You]1434-you come here and listen to [gentlemen]607-gentlemen who give [you]1434-you an account of the sacrifices [they]607-gentlemen make for [the heathen]387-the heathen , and of results which do not look so well on the spot as on paper ; and because [you]1434-you throw a pound into that vase in the presence of [the company]861-the company , [you]1434-you think that [you]1434-you have done something for [them]607-gentlemen too . ' [They]607-gentlemen may give up all , ' [you]1434-you say , ' but [we]2835-we ca n't afford to save more than [two or three souls]2836-two or three souls per annum . ' "[1432-ladies] [Ladies]1432-ladies and [gentlemen]607-gentlemen , as far as [my]0-i experience goes , [you]1439-you neither of [you]1439-you as a rule give up anything for [the heathen]387-the heathen . [I]0-i can not , therefore , share in [your]1439-you wonder at the barren results of [your]1439-you missionary efforts . [The Tabernacle Missionary Society]103-the tabernacle missionary society , for instance , offers to [a young man of the lower middles]1441-a young man of the lower middles " ( [[Mr Beevy]244-mr beevy 's father]2837-mr beevy 's father was [a butcher]2838-a butcher , so [I]1441-a young man of the lower middles did not like to enter more fully into this part of the subject ) "[1441-a young man of the lower middles] the opportunity of becoming [a reverend]1442-a reverend and [a gentleman]495-a gentleman , and thus advancing a step in society . It gives [him]1441-a young man of the lower middles — 300 a - year to begin with , — 80 a - year more with [[his]1441-a young man of the lower middles wife]2351-his wife , — 20 a - year with [[his]1441-a young man of the lower middles first child]1445-his first child , and — 10 a - year with each succeeding olive - branch . It educates these free of expense at [Holloway]104-holloway , and it pays an indefinite number of passages between [England]10-england and [the ' mission - field]1446-the ' mission - field , ' according as the health of [the family]494-the family requires it ; and permit [me]0-i to say that , if to receive between — 400 and — 500 a - year in a tolerable climate , with [a comfortable house]1448-a comfortable house rent - free , and the prospect of a pension at the end , is to give up all for [the heathen]387-the heathen , [I]0-i have [myself]0-i made the experiment without personal discomfort . Perhaps [I]0-i speak with a certain feeling of bitterness on this subject , for [I]0-i can not forget that upon one occasion while residing among [the heathen]387-the heathen , [a gentleman who is now present]1451-a gentleman who is now present , and who had sacrificed [his]1451-a gentleman who is now present all for [them]387-the heathen , outbid [me]0-i for a horse at an auction after [I]0-i had run [him]1451-a gentleman who is now present up to sixty guineas . With such a magnificent institution as this for supplying ' purse ' and ' scrip , ' and for ' taking thought for the morrow ' in the way of pensions , & c. , tell [me]0-i honestly whether [you]1452-you think [you]1452-you deserve real , not nominal conversions ? [You]1452-you have instituted a sort of ' civil service , ' with which ' [you]1452-you compass [sea and land]1453-sea and land to make [one proselyte]1454-one proselyte . ' [You]1452-you go to [him]1451-a gentleman who is now present with a number of bibles , [Armstrong guns]1455-armstrong guns , [drunken sailors]1456-drunken sailors , and [unscrupulous traders]1457-unscrupulous traders , a combination which goes to make up what [you]1452-you call ' civilisation , ' and [you]1452-you wonder that [[your]1452-you converts]1458-your converts are actuated by the same motive which [[my]0-i own Hindoo servant]1459-my own hindoo servant once told [me]0-i induced [him]1459-my own hindoo servant to leave [his]1459-my own hindoo servant own religion , in which [he]1459-my own hindoo servant could not venture to get drunk , and become [a Christian]431-a christian . " Do [you]1452-you think it is the fault of the religion that [you]1452-you do n't make [converts]2839-converts , or the fault of the system under which it is propagated ? If [you]1452-you gave up ' the enticing words of [man]2840-man 's wisdom , ' and tried a little of ' the demonstration of the spirit and of power , ' do n't [you]1452-you think the result would be different ? If [you]1452-you are only illumined by ' a dim religious light ' [yourselves]1452-you , how do [you]1452-you expect to dissipate the gross darkness of paganism ? [You]1452-you have only got an imitation blaze that warms [nobody]579-nobody at [home]330-home , and [you]1452-you wonder when [you]1452-you take it [abroad]2843-abroad that it leaves [everybody]318-everybody as cold and as dead as it finds [them]318-everybody . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear Christian friends]1461-my dear christian friends , in the face of the living contradiction which [we]1462-we all present in [our]1462-we conduct to the religion [we]1462-we profess , [[our]1462-we missionaries]1463-our missionaries can only convince [the heathen]387-the heathen of the truth of Christianity by living the life upon which that religion is based , by means of which it can alone be powerful , and which is only now not lived by [Christians]1409-christians , because , as was prophesied , there is no ' faith on [the earth]1316-the earth . ' [I]0-i have spoken to [you]1461-my dear christian friends faithfully , even harshly , but , believe [me]0-i , [I]0-i have done so in a spirit of love . If [you]1461-my dear christian friends can take it in the same spirit , [I]0-i shall feel [I]0-i have done [you]1461-my dear christian friends a great injustice . " [I]0-i was so excited while delivering [myself]0-i of these observations that [I]0-i was quite unconscious of the effect [I]0-i was producing . [I]0-i remember there was a deathlike silence , and that when [I]0-i sat down [the gentlemen behind the table]2845-the gentlemen behind the table looked flushed and agitated . [The religious world]509-the religious world has a more choice catalogue of epithets for [[their]509-the religious world enemies]2849-their enemies than [any other section of [the community]2851-the community]2850-any other section of the community . [I]0-i need not therefore suggest "[0-i] ribald " as appropriate to the present occasion . Finally , the proceedings terminated in some confusion ; before [they]308-my readers did , however , [I]0-i rose again to point out how completely the conduct of [those present]2853-those present had proved [my]0-i case — either the faults to which [I]0-i alluded existed , and there was nothing more to be said ; or [I]0-i had buffeted [them]308-my readers without cause , and [they]308-my readers had not "[0-i] taken it patiently , " a course of conduct quite inexcusable in a meeting composed exclusively of [dear Christian friends]1898-dear christian friends . If there is a thing [I]0-i yearn for , it is the love of [[my]0-i fellow - men]273-my fellow - men . By making [the "[0-i] worldly - holies]2856-the " worldly - holies " consider [me]0-i [an enemy]2857-an enemy , [I]0-i ought to secure an unusual share of [their]308-my readers affection . Remember , now , if [you]2858-you abuse [me]0-i for this , it is unchristian ; if [you]2858-you leave [me]0-i alone , [you]2858-you will be treating [me]0-i "[0-i] with the contempt [I]0-i deserve , " and that is unchristian too ; the right thing for [you]2858-you to do is to take the charitable view , to admit that [my]0-i motives may be good , even if the means employed are injudicious . When [I]0-i am abruptly asked in an omnibus , by [an entire stranger]2859-an entire stranger , who may happen to belong to [the "[0-i] straitest sect]2860-the " straitest sect , " the most solemn question which [one man]594-one man can put to another , [I]0-i do not resent it . [I]0-i believe [he]594-one man is sincerely trying to "[0-i] awaken [me]0-i " with a "[0-i] word in season . " [I]0-i question the taste , but [I]0-i respect the motive . [We]2863-we are all bad , and [I]0-i am far worse than any of [you]2858-you ; but still [I]0-i may show how bad the best of [us]2863-we are . Depend upon it , [we]2863-we are all a great deal too comfortable to be safe . " "[240-miss wylde] [You]240-miss wylde know , " [he]2880-he went on , "[240-miss wylde] [she]124-lady ursula is the last person in [the world]271-the world with whom [I]0-i imagined it possible [I]0-i could have been in love : [she]124-lady ursula says the most dreadful things sometimes — and [I]0-i am afraid [they]1504-they amuse [me]0-i more than [they]1504-they should ; there is no doubt about [her]124-lady ursula being immensely clever , but [she]124-lady ursula is quite taken up with [the world]271-the world as yet . Now it so happens that [I]2022-my lord have a remarkable faculty of remembering faces , and [I]2022-my lord had been conscious for some weeks past of being familiar with the particularly ill - favoured countenance of [[Lady Broadhem]166-lady broadhem 's butler]2894-lady broadhem 's butler ; but it was not until now that the circumstances under which [I]2022-my lord had first seen it flashed upon [me]2022-my lord . " "[166-lady broadhem] [I]0-i never have yet , " [I]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i began by telling [you]166-lady broadhem that the idea only occurred to [me]0-i lately in its new form . " "[2483-your sister] Yes , " said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem . "[2483-your sister] Do [you]166-lady broadhem know [you]166-lady broadhem are quite [a different sort of fellow]1606-a different sort of fellow from what [I]0-i imagined . " "[0-i] That was because [I]0-i lived exactly like [[my]0-i neighbours]1607-my neighbours , without adding to [my]0-i daily life the sin of professing belief in a religion to which it was diametrically opposed . [Most of [the sceptics of the present day]1609-the sceptics of the present day]1608-most of the sceptics of the present day are driven to [their]1608-most of the sceptics of the present day opinions by [their]1608-most of the sceptics of the present day consciences , which revolt against the current hypocrisy and glaring inconsistencies that characterise the profession of the popular theology . As a class [I]0-i have found [them]1608-most of the sceptics of the present day honester , and in every way [better men than [modern Christians]1611-modern christians]1610-better men than modern christians . " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i know why ? " "[0-i] No , " said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem . "[0-i] Because [modern Christians]1611-modern christians do n't really believe much more than [sceptics]1613-sceptics — [a man]302-a man 's life is the result of [his]302-a man internal , not [his]302-a man external belief . There can be no life separate from internal belief , and the lives of [men]1940-men are imperfect because [their]1940-men belief is external . The right thing believed the right way must inevitably produce the perfect life . Either , then , [the civilised world]1616-the civilised world believes the wrong thing , or [it]1616-the civilised world believes the right thing the wrong way . In other words , faith and charity are inseparable , and when one is perfect the other is too . That is what [I]0-i mean by ' living the life . ' " "[0-i] According to that , [you]1617-you would make out that [nobody]579-nobody rightly believes the Christian religion who is not perfect ; that , [you]1617-you know , is ridiculous , " said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem . "[0-i] That is , nevertheless , exactly what [I]0-i do mean . To know the doctrine , it is necessary to do the will . [Christians of the present day]1619-christians of the present day adopt certain theological dogmas intellectually and call [them]1619-christians of the present day [their]1619-christians of the present day religious belief . This has a superficial and varying influence upon [their]1619-christians of the present day lives , for it consists merely of opinions which are liable to change . The only kind of faith which is inseparable from life is a divine conviction of truth imparted to the intellect through the heart , and which becomes as absolute to the internal conscience as [one]301-one 's existence , and as impossible of proof . It may be added to , but what has once been thus accepted can never be changed . Such a faith can not be selfish , for it has been derived from the affections , hence the life must be charitable . But the modern Christian belief , received by an effort of pure reason directly through the intellect , is not a divine intuition , which , if embodied , would result in a perfect life and a united Church , but a theological problem which [professors of religion]1621-professors of religion , unlike [professors of mathematics]1622-professors of mathematics , are at liberty to solve for [their]1621-professors of religion own benefit , according to [their]1621-professors of religion own taste , and to quarrel about incessantly , thereby giving occasion to the thoughtless to scoff , and to the thoughtful to reject all revelation as ' foolishness'—since it is incapable of demonstration by the Baconian method,—the only one known to [these ' wise and prudent ' philosophers]1623-these ' wise and prudent ' philosophers , but one by which , fortunately for [them]1623-these ' wise and prudent ' philosophers , ' [babes]1624-babes ' are not expected to prove [their]1624-babes relationship before believing in [[their]1624-babes mothers]1625-their mothers . " "[1626-you] Then , " said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , "[1626-you] [you]1626-you actually mean to say that the whole of [Christendom]26-christendom is wanting in this faith ? " "[1626-you] [I]0-i fear that almost universally [they]1627-they mistake a bare belief for faith . [Their]1627-they theology thus becomes an act of memory instead of a rule of life , and Christianity is reduced to a superstition . The only way of distinguishing superstition from true religion is by an examination of results . But where are the fruits of modern Christianity ? If it be absolutely true , and all - sufficient for purposes of regeneration , how am [I]0-i to account for the singular fact that there is as much wickedness in [London]5-london in the year 1865 A.D. , as there was in [Jerusalem]102-jerusalem in the year 1 B.C. ? If the object of the last revelation was to take the place of the one before it , and to reform [the world]271-the world , why are [the best modern Christians of [my]0-i acquaintance]1629-the best modern christians of my acquaintance no holier than [the best modern Jews whom [I]0-i have the honour to know]1630-the best modern jews whom i have the honour to know ? " "[166-lady broadhem] But the object of the last revelation was not to reform [the world]271-the world , but to save it , " [he]302-a man replied . "[166-lady broadhem] Thanks , [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , for having put in rather too epigrammatic a form , perhaps , to please [those who believe it , the most diabolical sophism that was ever invented to beguile a Church]1632-those who believe it , the most diabolical sophism that was ever invented to beguile a church — the doctrine that [men]1940-men can be saved by opinion without practice : that [a man]302-a man 's practice may be bad , and yet because [his]302-a man faith is good [his]302-a man salvation is sure — that [he]302-a man can , by such a miserable philosophy as would disgrace the justice of [the earth]1316-the earth , escape the just sentence to be passed upon all [his]302-a man deeds . The results of so fatal a dogma must be [a Church that tends to atheism]1636-a church that tends to atheism , and that loves corruption . There is in every heart a something that speaks against this , and speaks with a burning language that sweeps the invisible chords of the inmost consciousness , and awakens a torrent of indignant denial of the shallow sophistry that [a man]302-a man can be saved if [his]302-a man thoughts and life are bad . If [he]302-a man cherish self - love , and the love of ruling others , though [he]302-a man intrench the intellect in the midst of all creeds , and span the reason with all faiths , making a sacred public profession before [all men]1638-all men , [he]302-a man but adds to the heinousness of [his]302-a man crime , and makes more terrible the fast - coming and final judgment . " [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem stopped suddenly in [the street]283-the street as [I]116-lord frank finished in a somewhat excited tone , and gasped rather than spoke , "[116-lord frank] [Frank]116-lord frank , [you]116-lord frank literally astound [me]0-i . [I]0-i could never have believed it possible [you]116-lord frank would have come out in that line . Are those [your]116-lord frank own ideas or another 's ? " "[116-lord frank] Another 's , " [I]0-i replied , coolly . "[0-i] [I]0-i believe [they]1639-they are rather unsound , but [I]0-i commend [them]1639-they to [your]1640-your notice , because , if [they]1639-they are not correct , Christianity will soon cease to exist , even in name ; but if they are , then it contains within it a regenerating power hitherto undeveloped , whereby [the world]271-the world may be absolutely reformed . [I]0-i will venture to assert that [Christian nations]1642-christian nations will make no moral progress so long as [they]1642-christian nations continue to cherish the pagan superstition that religion consists in trying to save [themselves]1642-christian nations by virtue of a creed , instead of in trying to save [others]307-others by the virtues of a life . " "[1639-they] But that 's works , " said [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem . "[1639-they] Yes , " [I]1639-they repeated , "[1639-they] that 's works , but of a kind only possible when accompanied by intuitive living faith , which [I]0-i have just endeavoured to describe . There is a promise that ' greater works than these shall [they]1639-they do ' who ' believe . ' Why , [I]0-i want to know , have these ' works , ' greater than any that were then accomplished , and which would reform [the world]271-the world , never been attempted ? Because [people]293-people do n't believe in the tremendous power of disinterestedness , and [they]293-people ca n't face the severe training which the perfection of self - sacrifice involves . So one set of ' worldly - holies ' regard all personal discipline as a tempting snare to be avoided , and entertain a great horror of what [they]293-people conceitedly term ' [their]293-people own merits . ' This very superfluous sentiment , combined with a selfish belief in certain doctrinals ( of which [they]293-people usually do make a merit ) , is enough , [they]293-people imagine — the ' works ' will follow ; and so [they]293-people do , and take the form [we]1646-we have just seen in [[your]1647-your mother]419-your mother 's drawing - room . Another set delight in a mild — sthetic sort of training , to be performed in a particular costume , according to the obsolete ceremonial rules of a Church ' which is divided against itself , ' and [their]293-people works take the fatuous form of ecclesiastical high art . [Others]307-others , again , go to a still further extreme , and consider discipline not the means but the end . Hence [they]293-people go through [their]293-people drill in seclusion , exclusively for [their]293-people own benefit , and [their]293-people works take the form of scourgings and horse - hair shirts , and other mortifications of the flesh , which do no good to [themselves]293-people nor to [anybody else]775-anybody else . And then , in strong contrast , are [those who train enough in all conscience with ' gloves , ' single - stick , sculls , and all suchlike appliances , and whose works take the form of tubbing , volunteering , and a general jovial philanthropy]1651-those who train enough in all conscience with ' gloves , ' single - stick , sculls , and all suchlike appliances , and whose works take the form of tubbing , volunteering , and a general jovial philanthropy . [I]0-i am not sure that [they]293-people are not [the most hopeful set after all]1652-the most hopeful set after all ; [they]293-people believe in severe muscular training as necessary to produce great physical results . Get [them]293-people to accept , the possibility of [the world]271-the world 's regeneration by a divinely - directed effort of heroic spiritual discipline on the part of [its inhabitants]1654-its inhabitants , and [you]1647-your might convert [them]293-people from ' physical ' into ' moral force ' [Christians]251-christians . [They]293-people understand the efficacy of ' a long pull , and a strong pull , and a pull all together ; ' and [they]293-people might be shown that the real place for a ' biceps ' is the will , not the arms ; and instead of a body ' as hard as nails , ' the chief aim of [one]301-one 's life should be to bring [one]301-one 's spirit to that condition—'hard , ' be it understood , in the sense of being impervious to the influences which weaken and demoralise it — hard in [its]1657-its resistance to the tyranny of society , to the claims of [family]1573-family or [friends]674-friends , and to the force of ' natural ' ties , where any of these things interfere with the ' spiritual ' training . It is only by thus remaining in [the world]271-the world , and yet refusing to concede a jot to it upon any pretence , however plausible , that it is possible to acquire the internal isolation and strength of will necessary to the achievement of ' these greater works . ' Depend upon it , the task of performing them is not hopeless because it seems stupendous . There are spiritual forces now latent in humanity powerful enough to restore a fallen universe ; but [they]293-people want to be called into action by fire . [They]293-people are in a cold fluid state , and must be turned into stone . Sublime moment ! when , conscious of the Titanic agency within [them]293-people , and burning with desire to give it expression , [men]1940-men first unite to embody , and then with irresistible potency to impart to [others]307-others that ' Life ' which is ' the Light of [men]1940-men . ' " As [I]1666-zealots was thus speaking , [we]2908-we turned into [Piccadilly]7-piccadilly , and an arm was passed through [mine]1666-zealots . " "[1666-zealots] Why is it , ask you?"—and the clear solemn voice of [[my]1666-zealots new companion]2909-my new companion startled [Broadhem]166-lady broadhem , who had not seen [him]2909-my new companion join [me]1666-zealots , so that [I]1666-zealots felt [his]2909-my new companion arm tremble upon [mine]1666-zealots . "[1666-zealots] Ask rather why [sects]1665-sects are fierce and intolerant ; why worship is formal and irreverent ; why [zealots]1666-zealots run to fierce frenzies and react to atheistic chills ; why piety is constrained and lifeless , like antique pictures painted by [the old Byzantines]1667-the old byzantines upon a golden ground ; why [Puseyism]252-puseyism tries to whip piety to life with scourges , and starve out sin with fasts ; why the altar is made a stage where [Ritualists]1668-ritualists delight [a gaping crowd]1669-a gaping crowd , and the pulpit a place where [the sleek official drones away the sleepy hour]1670-the sleek official drones away the sleepy hour ; why religious books are the dullest ; why [the clergyman]1671-the clergyman is looked upon by [the millions]1672-the millions as a barrel - organ , whom [the sect]1673-the sect turns like [the wandering Savoyard]1674-the wandering savoyard , unable to evolve a free - born note . There is but one answer — — " and [he]2909-my new companion stopped abruptly . "[130-god] What is it ? " [I]1675-i said , timidly , for [I]1675-i was overwhelmed by the torrent of [his]2909-my new companion eloquence . "[1675-i] [We]1675-i have lost [[our]1675-i [God]130-god]1676-our god ! That is why [men]1940-men are unconscious of [His]130-god force within [them]1940-men . It is a terrible thing for [a nation]593-a nation to lose [its]593-a nation God .
